Field: BELGIAN
Location: NMWSS
Equipment ID: Well 34-22R FL
Inspection Dates:
Last: 05/30/2012
Next: 05/30/2022
Inspector: Brandon Meadows
Report(s):
{rsfiles path=""data/belgian/field/api570/flow_lines/well_34-22r_fl/2012/belgian_field_well_34-22r_fl_report_053012.pdf""}
{rsfiles path=""data/belgian/field/api570/flow_lines/well_34-22r_fl/2012/belgian_field_well_34-22r_fl_ultrapipe_053012.pdf""}
{rsfiles path=""data/belgian/field/api570/flow_lines/well_34-22r_fl/2012/belgian_field_well_34-22r_fl_field_drawing_053012.pdf""}
Comments:
Ultrasonic A-Scan Thickness Inspection:
Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness measurements were completed in accordance with Applus RTD ‚Äì Valley Industrial
X-Ray established procedures. 19 thickness measurement locations (TMLs) were established and thickness measurements were taken at these locations.
All thickness readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data next inspection will be 05/30/2022 based on a 2 mil per year corrosion rate. The predicted retirement date of the circuit is 05/30/2073.
There are 0 caution TMLs per the current thickness reading taken on 05-30-2012.
API 570 Visual Inspection:
Visual inspection found this piping circuit to be in fair condition. The installation of this circuit was found incomplete at the well casing. The Well will be reactivated utilizing new and old existing piping. Piping has surface rust around welds, heat affected zones, support shoes, bolting, and insulation interfaces. Some scale & C.U.I was found inside damaged areas of insulation. Insulation seals are failing and may require re-caulking & or possible re-insulating entire line due to the conditions of the insulation. Support may be needed downstream of the first expansion loop. The pipe is slightly sagging downward at this location. Just before the last road crossing the insulated pipe goes under soil which appeared to have washed down the slope onto piping. An arc strike was found Near CML 4 just before the line descends at a 45¬∞ down the hill. The piping was inspected for code compliance issues and to identify possible leaks, stresses and any condition that might reduce the life of the piping circuit. All piping will be put on a maximum 10 year thickness inspection interval per API (class 3 piping) requirements. Some piping TML locations may require re-inspection prior to the maximum interval. See UltraPIPE data reports for all required inspection dates.
All piping will require an API 570 Visual inspection in 10 years.
UltraPipe Unit ID BELGIAN
UltraPipe Circuit ID WELL_34-22R_FL

Comments:
Ultrasonic A-Scan Thickness Inspection:
Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness measurements were completed in accordance with Applus RTD ‚Äì Valley Industrial
X-Ray established procedures. 29 thickness measurement locations (TMLs) were established and thickness measurements were taken at these locations. An Olympus 38 Plus using a D-791 transducer was used for examining this circuit.
All thickness readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data next inspection will be 06/04/2022 based on a default 2 mill corrosion rate. The predicted retirement date of the circuit is 12/04/2062.
There are 0 caution TMLs per the current thickness reading taken on 06/04/2012.
API 570 Visual Inspection:
Visual inspection found this piping circuit to be in fair condition. A 2‚Äù threaded valve was found leaking oil between TML 2 & 3 near the well. A shoe was found completely off the support between TML 18 & 19 on vertical expansion loop and should be re-positioned back onto the pipe support to eliminate further damages to the insulation. Liquid hammering can eventually rub a hole into the insulation and cause metal on metal friction. This will cause fatigue stresses at this location and is susceptible to fatigue cracking. Some debris was found on the pipe and insulation along with moderate surface rust around welds, insulation interfaces & support shoes. Some insulation damaged penetrations were found also areas around supports and hangers were missing insulation seals. The piping was inspected for code compliance issues and to identify possible leaks, stresses and any condition that might reduce the life of the piping circuit. All piping will be put on a maximum 10 year thickness inspection interval per API (class 3 piping) requirements. Some piping TML locations may require re-inspection prior to the maximum interval. See UltraPIPE data reports for all required inspection dates.
All piping will require an API 570 Visual inspection in 10 years.

Comments:
Ultrasonic A-Scan Thickness Inspection:
Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness measurements were completed in accordance with Applus RTD ‚Äì Valley Industrial X-Ray established procedures. Olympus 38 DL Plus with a D-791 RM search unit in standard mode, 8 thickness measurement locations (TMLs) were established and thickness measurements were taken at these locations.
All thickness readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data next inspection will be 11/02/2019 based on a 2 mil per year corrosion rate. The predicted retirement date of the circuit is 05/04/2027.
There are 0 caution TMLs per the current thickness reading taken on 05/03/2012.
API 570 Visual Inspection:
Visual inspection found this piping circuit to be in fair condition. This piping is an existing, in-service circuit. Some debris & surface rust was found on the pipe & welds. Product build up found on and along CML 1. Line was properly supported and all bolting appeared to be secure. The piping was inspected for code compliance issues and to identify possible leaks, stresses and any condition that might reduce the life of the piping circuit. All piping will be put on a maximum 10 year thickness inspection interval per API (class 2 piping) requirements. Some piping TML locations may require re-inspection prior to the maximum interval. See UltraPIPE data reports for all required inspection dates.
All piping will require an API 570 Visual inspection in 5 years.

Ultrasonic A-Scan Thickness Inspection:
Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness measurements were completed in accordance with Applus RTD É?? Valley Industrial X-Ray established procedures. 17 thickness measurement locations (TMLs) were established and thickness measurements were taken at these locations.
All thickness readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data next inspection will be 11/02/2015 based on a 2 mil per year corrosion rate. The predicted retirement date of the circuit is 05/04/2019.
There are 0 caution TMLs per the current thickness reading taken on 05/03/2012.
API 570 Visual Inspection:
Visual inspection found this piping circuit to be in fair condition and is found in service. Operating pressure is 3 PSI and temperature is approximately 95?¯F at this time. Light surface rust was found at welds and heat affected zones. Oil debris was found near the casing and random locationÉ??s on the line was found partially covered with soil. Recommend in these areas the soil be removed and or the pipe properly supported above the soil. The flow line of this well is experiencing cyclic movement and is found resting on top of this CVR line causing additional stresses at this area. It is recommended that this flow line should be supported to provide clearance. This area is located near CML 7. Some external pitting was found from CML 11-17 ranging 0.005É?ù-0.050É?ù deep. No centralizer was found for the road crossing culvert. The piping was inspected for code compliance issues and to identify possible leaks, stresses and any condition that might reduce the life of the piping circuit. INSPECTION REPORT (615 kB)
ULTRAPIPE DATA REPORT (38 KB)
FIELD DRAWING (1.375 MB)
MANUFACTURE U1-A (615 kB)
Comments:
OUT OF SERVICE PER TYE HAMMOND 05/29/2013
Ultrasonic A-Scan Inspection:
Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness measurements were performed on shell and head, nozzles.
All readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data the vessel has thickness readings below t-min. The predicted retirement date of the vessel was 9/22/2011 based on a 1 mil a year default corrosion rate. There are 4 caution tml locations per the current thickness reading taken 6/28/12 that are below min. required thickness and 8 thickness readings at min required thickness. This vessel was built at t-min with .001É?ù between nominal thickness and pressure t-min.
API 510 External Inspection:
External inspection found the vessel to be good condition. The coating on this vessels exterior shell and head is in fair condition. This vessel is supported by 3 legs mounted on a concrete pad and securely fastened. The concrete pad is in good condition. All threaded connection to the shell OD. There?ˇ?ˇ is no visible evident of leakage are corrosion found on this vessel. No dents, bulges or deformations were found in external surface. The next visual inspection will be time based at 5 years.
Recommendations: Replace vessel.
API 510 Internal Inspection:
Internal inspection was not completed during this inspection.
UltraPipe Unit ID HOMEBASE
UltraPipe Circuit ID V-3

Comments:
Ultrasonic A-Scan Thickness Inspection:
Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness measurements were completed in accordance with Applus RTD ‚Äì Valley Industrial
X-Ray established procedures. 20 thickness measurement locations (TMLs) were established and thickness measurements were taken at these locations. An Olympus 38 Plus using a D-791 transducer was used for examining this circuit.
All thickness readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data next inspection will be 05/15/2022 based on a default 2 mill corrosion rate. The predicted retirement date of the circuit is 11/14/2059.
There are 0 caution TMLs per the current thickness reading taken on 05/15/2012.
API 570 Visual Inspection:
Visual inspection found this piping circuit to be in fair condition. This piping circuit is currently undergoing steam injection. This is causing the support shoes on the vertical expansion loops to have lift-off from the pipe support from the thermal expansion. Some debris was found on the pipe and insulation along with moderate surface rust around welds, insulation interfaces & support shoes. Some insulation damaged penetrations were found also areas around supports and hangers were missing insulation seals. The piping was inspected for code compliance issues and to identify possible leaks, stresses and any condition that might reduce the life of the piping circuit. All piping will be put on a maximum 10 year thickness inspection interval per API (class 3 piping) requirements. Some piping TML locations may require re-inspection prior to the maximum interval. See UltraPIPE data reports for all required inspection dates.
All piping will require an API 570 Visual inspection in 10 years.
UltraPipe Unit ID 21Z
UltraPipe Circuit ID WELL_A-3_FL

Some debris was found on the pipe and insulation along with moderate surface rust around welds, insulation interfaces & support shoes. Some insulation damaged penetrations were found also areas around supports and hangers were missing insulation seals. Comments:
Ultrasonic A-Scan Thickness Inspection:
Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness measurements were completed in accordance with Applus RTD ‚Äì Valley Industrial
X-Ray established procedures. 48 thickness measurement locations (TMLs) were established and thickness measurements were taken at these locations.
All thickness readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data next inspection will be 06/14/2022 based on a default 2 mil per year corrosion rate. The predicted retirement date of the circuit is 06/15/2055.
There are 0 caution TMLs per the current thickness reading taken on 06/14/2012.
API 570 Visual Inspection:
Visual inspection found this piping circuit to be in fair condition. The Well is reactivated utilizing new and old existing piping. Piping has surface rust around welds, heat affected zones, support shoes, bolting, and insulation interfaces. This line is partially insulated and has no seals. Just before the last road crossing the insulated pipe travels beneath the soil. This area may lead to damaged insulation if any standing water should occur. The piping was inspected for code compliance issues and to identify possible leaks, stresses and any condition that might reduce the life of the piping circuit. All piping will be put on a maximum 10 year thickness inspection interval per API (class 3 piping) requirements. Some piping TML locations may require re-inspection prior to the maximum interval. Insulation seals are failing. New insulation was installed but still some small areas have insulation interfaces which are leaving the pipe exposed. Just before the last road crossing the insulated pipe travels beneath the soil. This area may lead to damaged insulation if any standing water should occur. The piping was inspected for code compliance issues and to identify possible leaks, stresses and any condition that might reduce the life of the piping circuit. Comments:
Ultrasonic A-Scan Thickness Inspection:
Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness measurements were completed in accordance with Applus RTD É?? Valley Industrial
X-Ray established procedures. 9 Thickness measurement locations (TMLs) were established and thickness measurements were taken at these locations.
All thickness readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data next inspection will be 5/10/2017 based on a 2 mill a year default corrosion rate. The predicted retirement date of the circuit is 7/23/2054.
There are 0 caution TMLs per the current thickness reading taken on 5/10/2012.
API 570 Visual Inspection:
Visual inspection found this piping circuit to be in good condition. This piping was found to be insulated and in good condition .The external (OD) on this piping could not be inspected do to insulation covering this piping at time of inspection. Visible this piping was found to be free of any leakage. All piping supports were in place and structurally sound and in fair condition. The piping was inspected for code compliance issues and to identify possible leaks, stresses and any condition that might reduce the life of the piping circuit. All piping will be put on a maximum 5 year thickness inspection interval per API (class 2 piping) requirements. Some piping TML locations may require re-inspection prior to the maximum interval. See UltraPIPE data reports for all required inspection dates.
All piping will require an API 570 Visual inspection in 5 years.
UltraPipe Unit ID POSO
UltraPipe Circuit ID FL-102

Comments:
Ultrasonic A-Scan Thickness Inspection
Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness measurements were completed in accordance with Applus RTD É?? Valley Industrial X-Ray established procedures. 89 thickness measurement locations (TMLs) were established and thickness measurements were taken at these locations. All thickness readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data next inspection will be 07/26/2017. The predicted retirement date of the circuit is 03/14/2050 based on default 2 mil per year corrosion rate. There are 0 caution TMLs per the current thickness reading taken on 07/26/2012.
API 570 Visual Inspection
Visual inspection found this piping circuit to be in fair condition. This piping circuit was sand blasted previously to remove old coating or wrapping. Corrosion was found on approximately 50-75% of the external surfaces. A pit gage was used to measure the pitting depth; pitting ranges from 0.005 to 0.045. The external corrosion and pitting does not appear to be detrimental to piping circuit at this time. Pitting was most likely caused by wrapping or insulation previously on the pipe. The piping is supported by concrete blocks and the supports are in fair condition. There are no shoes attached to this piping.
The piping was inspected for code compliance issues and to identify possible leaks, stresses and any condition that might reduce the life of the piping circuit. All piping will be put on a maximum 5 year thickness inspection interval per API (class 2 piping) requirements. Some piping TML locations may require re-inspection prior to the maximum interval. See UltraPIPE data reports for all required inspection dates.
Recommendations: Recoat the piping. Monitor external corrosion and pitting for degradation. Consider excavating a few locations to inspect buried piping for external corrosion and pitting.
Buried Pipe Inspection
A 7 foot long section of buried pipe was excavated and prepped for UT thickness scanning. Scanning was completed at 8 separate locations along the 7 foot run. The pipe was scanned 100% and the lowest reading recorded in each quadrant was recorded. The thickness readings are consistent with 4É?ù Sch. 40 nominal pipe and all readings were within the 12.5% under-run tolerance. No signs of internal corrosion were noted during the scanning. See scan results on page 8. Reference field drawing for scan locations.
UltraPipe Unit ID Cogen38
UltraPipe Circuit ID GL-100

Visual inspection found this piping circuit to be in good condition. The line was found completely insulated and securely supported. The insulation and seals are in good condition. The support shoes and shoe brackets are in good condition with minor surface rust. The piping was inspected for code compliance issues and to identify possible leaks, stresses and any condition that might reduce the life of the piping circuit. All piping will be put on a maximum 10 year thickness inspection interval per API (class 3 piping) requirements. Some piping TML locations may require re-inspection prior to the maximum interval. {rsfiles path=""data/21z/api570/manifolds/271/2012/21z_manifold-271_report_052312.pdf""}
{rsfiles path=""data/21z/api570/manifolds/271/2012/21z_manifold-271_ultrapipe_052312.pdf""}
{rsfiles path=""data/21z/api570/manifolds/271/2012/21z_manifold-271_fielddrawing_052312.pdf""}
Comments:
Ultrasonic A-Scan Thickness Inspection:
Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness measurements were completed in accordance with Applus RTD ‚Äì Valley Industrial
X-Ray established procedures. AWT271-1, 2 & 3 all have 34 readings on each header, SH-101,102 & 103 all have 9 readings taken on each spider header. Thickness measurement locations (TMLs) were established and thickness measurements were taken at these locations. An Olympus 38 Plus using a D-790 transducer was used for examining this circuit.
All thickness readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data next inspection will be 05/23/2012 based on a default 2 mill corrosion rate. The earliest predicted retirement date of the circuit is 07/23/2033 for AWT-271-1.
There are 0 caution TMLs per the current thickness reading taken on 05-23-2012.
API 570 Visual Inspection:
Visual inspection found this piping circuit to be in good condition. Surface rust was found around welds, insulation interfaces & support shoes. The pressure gauges are in good condition with minor debris. Some lines are not in service, some are in steam service and some are in normal service. This can account for the major differences in temperature and pressure conditions. The piping was inspected for code compliance issues and to identify possible leaks, stresses and any condition that might reduce the life of the piping circuit. All piping will be put on a maximum 5 year thickness inspection interval per API (class 2 piping) requirements. Some piping TML locations may require re-inspection prior to the maximum interval. See UltraPIPE data reports for all required inspection dates.
All piping will require an API 570 Visual inspection in 5 years.
UltraPipe Unit ID 21Z

Comments:
Ultrasonic A-Scan Thickness Inspection:
Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness measurements were completed in accordance with Applus RTD ‚Äì Valley Industrial
X-Ray established procedures. 7 thickness measurement locations (TMLs) were established and thickness measurements were taken at these locations.
All thickness readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data next inspection will be 04/02/2022 based on a 2 mil per year corrosion rate. The predicted retirement date of the circuit is 10/03/2119.
There are 0 caution TMLs per the current thickness reading taken on 04/02/12.
API 570 Visual Inspection:
Visual inspection found this piping circuit to be in good condition. The flow line is currently producing oil and no gauges were found. The line was found completely insulated and securely supported. The insulation and seals are in good condition. The support shoes and shoe brackets are in good condition with minor surface rust. The piping was inspected for code compliance issues and to identify possible leaks, stresses and any condition that might reduce the life of the piping circuit. All piping will be put on a maximum 10 year thickness inspection interval per API (class 3 piping) requirements. Some piping TML locations may require re-inspection prior to the maximum interval. See UltraPIPE data reports for all required inspection dates.
All piping will require an API 570 Visual inspection in 10 years.

INSPECTION REPORT
635.93 KB
FIELD DRAWING
764.97 KB
Comments:
Ultrasonic A-Scan Thickness Inspection
Ultrasonic Thickness scanning was completed on a small portion of the 10É?ù Wimco line to T-106 as directed. Readings were taken at regular intervals along the area of interest. Most locations scanned showed general corrosion along the vertical run. A few areas of isolated pitting were also found at some locations. The lowest reading found was .046É?ù at TML# 7 due to isolated pitting on the south wall of the pipe. See the reader sheet on page 8 of this report.
API 570 Visual Inspection
Visual inspection found this section of the Wimco piping circuit to be in poor condition. Visual inspection found numerous small pinhole leaks from internal corrosion. The piping is not coated and covered with moderate rust. No signs of external corrosion or pitting were found at this time. The piping was inspected for code compliance issues and to identify possible leaks, stresses and any condition that might reduce the life of the piping circuit.
Recommendations: Perform visual and thickness inspections on the rest of the Wimco line to identify other areas of corrosion. Consider excavating small portions of buried piping to inspect for internal or external corrosion. Replace corroded sections of piping.
UltraPipe Unit ID Formax
UltraPipe Circuit ID 10in-Wimco

X-Ray established procedures. 49 thickness measurement locations (TMLs) were established and thickness measurements were taken at these locations.

API 570 Visual Inspection
Visual inspection found this piping circuit to be in fair condition. The well is reactivated utilizing new and old existing piping. No access was permitted near the well. All areas visually inspected were outside the perimeter barricade.?ˇ Piping has surface rust around welds, heat affected zones, support shoes, bolting, and insulation interfaces.?ˇ Some scale & C.U.I was found inside damaged areas of insulation.?ˇ Insulation seals are failing.?ˇ New insulation was installed but still some small areas have insulation interfaces which are leaving the pipe exposed. Just before the last road crossing the insulated pipe travels beneath the soil.?ˇ This area may lead to damaged insulation if any standing water should occur. The piping was inspected for code compliance issues and to identify possible leaks, stresses and any condition that might reduce the life of the piping circuit. All piping will be put on a maximum 5 year thickness inspection interval per API (class 2 piping) requirements. Some piping TML locations may require re-inspection prior to the maximum interval. Comments:
Ultrasonic A-Scan Thickness Inspection:
Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness measurements were completed in accordance with Applus RTD É?? Valley Industrial
X-Ray established procedures. 16 thickness measurement locations (TMLs) were established and thickness measurements were taken at these locations. All thickness readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data next inspection will be 04/19/2022 based on a default 2 mil corrosion rate. The predicted retirement date of the circuit is 02/05/2045.
There are 0 caution TMLs per the current thickness reading taken on 04/19/12.
API 570 Visual Inspection:
Visual inspection found this piping circuit to be in good condition. Line is fully supported with light surface rust on the supports. Surface rust was found on the welds and heat affected zones. All bolting was secure, gaskets are in place and valves are in good operating condition. The line was found operating at approximately 5 to 70 PSI and the gauges are in good condition. Three expansion joints were found and all are properly aligned and in good condition. The piping was inspected for code compliance issues and to identify possible leaks, stresses and any condition that might reduce the life of the piping circuit. All piping will be put on a maximum 10 year thickness inspection interval per API (class 3 piping) requirements. Some piping TML locations may require re-inspection prior to the maximum interval. See UltraPIPE data reports for all required inspection dates.
All piping will require an API 570 Visual inspection in 10 years.

Report(s):
{rsfiles path=""data/main_camp/api570/flow_lines/well_c-3_fl/2012/maincamp_well_c-3_report_062012.pdf""}
{rsfiles path=""data/main_camp/api570/flow_lines/well_c-3_fl/2012/maincamp_well_c-3_ultrapipe_062012.pdf""}
{rsfiles path=""data/main_camp/api570/flow_lines/well_c-3_fl/2012/maincamp_well_c-3_fl_field-drawing_062012.pdf""}
Comments:
Ultrasonic A-Scan Thickness Inspection:
Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness measurements were completed in accordance with Applus RTD ‚Äì Valley Industrial
X-Ray established procedures. 15 thickness measurement locations (TMLs) were established and thickness measurements were taken at these locations. An Olympus 38 Plus using a D-790 transducer was used for examining this circuit. This is a new piping circuit; API 570 code indicates that piping shall not exceed a 12.5% tolerance for new piping. TML 3 is recorded as a 0.188‚Äù which is below the 12.5% tolerance for new piping when a 0.190‚Äù is 12.5% of 0.218‚Äù stated in the national standard piping chart.
All thickness readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data next inspection will be 06/20/2022 based on a default 2 mill corrosion rate. The predicted retirement date of the circuit is 12/20/2051.
There are 0 caution TMLs per the current thickness reading taken on 06/20/2012.
API 570 Visual Inspection:
Visual inspection found this piping circuit to be in good condition. This flow line is currently steaming into the well. Support shoes at expansion loops are experiencing thermal expansion causing support shoe lift-off from the pipe support. Surface rust was found around welds, insulation interfaces & support shoes. Insulation is in good condition and seals are intact. Loose bracket was found near TML 3. The piping was inspected for code compliance issues and to identify possible leaks, stresses and any condition that might reduce the life of the piping circuit. All piping will be put on a maximum 10 year thickness inspection interval per API (class 3 piping) requirements. Some piping TML locations may require re-inspection prior to the maximum interval. See UltraPIPE data reports for all required inspection dates.
All piping will require an API 570 Visual inspection in 10 years.
UltraPipe Unit ID MAINCAMP
UltraPipe Circuit ID WELL_C-3_FL

Comments:
Ultrasonic A-Scan Thickness Inspection:
Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness measurements were completed in accordance with Applus RTD É?? Valley Industrial
X-Ray established procedures. PW-102 (11 readings), PW-103 (9 readings), PW-104 (9 readings), PW-105 (11 readings), PW-106 (15 readings), PW-107 (15 readings), PW-108 (8 readings), PW-109 (12 readings), PW-110 (3 readings, PW-111 (4 readings), PW-112 (18 readings), PW-113 (4 readings), PW-114 (4 readings), PW-115 (3 readings) & PW-116 (44 readings). Thickness measurement locations (TMLs) were established and thickness measurements were taken at these locations. All thickness readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data next inspection will be 11-1-12 based on default 2 mils per year. The predicted retirement date of the circuit is 1-24-31.
There are 0 caution TMLs per the current thickness reading taken on 09/13/11.
API 570 Visual Inspection:
Visual inspection found this piping circuit to be in fair condition. Line is fully supported with surface rust on the supports, shoes, heat affected zones, soil to air interfaces, bolting & flanges. No pipe wrap was found and should be used at the soil to air interfaces. All bolting was secure, gaskets are in place and valves are in good operating condition. The piping was inspected for code compliance issues and to identify possible leaks, stresses and any condition that might reduce the life of the piping circuit. All piping will be put on a maximum 5 year thickness inspection interval per API (class 3 piping) requirements. Some piping TML locations may require re-inspection prior to the maximum interval. See UltraPIPE data reports for all required inspection dates.
All piping will require an API 570 Visual inspection in 5 years.

Comments:
Ultrasonic A-Scan Thickness Inspection:
Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness measurements were completed in accordance with Applus RTD É?? Valley Industrial
X-Ray established procedures. Thickness measurement locations (TMLs) were established and thickness measurements were taken at these locations: PG-100 through PG-104. All thickness readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data next inspection will be 10-10-2016 based on default 2 mils per year. The predicted retirement date of the circuit is 10-10-2029.
There are 0 caution TMLs per the current thickness reading taken on 10-07-2011.
API 570 Visual Inspection:
Visual inspection found this piping circuit in fair condition. Surface rust was found on the pipe, welds, heat affected zones, pipe supports and soil to air interfaces. Soil-to-air interfaces were found at random locations where the pipe is in contact with the soil. These areas should be wrapped or the soil beneath should be removed to provide clearance for any standing water. All bolting is fully engaged with moderate surface rust. Small oil leak was found on threaded fittings on drawing PG-101 near the connection to the psv line. Consider coating the entire circuit to minimize the external corrosion. The piping was inspected for code compliance issues and to identify possible leaks, stresses and any condition that might reduce the life of the piping circuit. All piping will be put on a maximum 5 year thickness inspection interval per API (class 2 piping) requirements. Some piping TML locations may require re-inspection prior to the maximum interval. Comments:
Ultrasonic A-Scan Thickness Inspection:
Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness measurements were completed in accordance with Applus RTD É?? Valley Industrial
X-Ray established procedures. 38 thickness measurement locations (TMLs) were established and thickness measurements were taken at these locations. The circuit consists of 10 deadlegs and one injection point location which were also UT A-scanned. The injection point consists of injecting SteamGen 7842 which was inspected per API 570 which requires thickness readings to be taken taken approximately 3 times the pipe diameter or 24É?ù whichever is greater upstream of the injection to the second change in direction or 25É?? whichever is less downstream of the injection. The UT inspection crew took thickness readings 30É?ù upstream to the soil to air interface (24É?ù below injection point) at 12É?ù intervals. 7 quadrants were inspected at this location. All thickness readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data next inspection will be 04/17/2017 based on a 2 mil per year corrosion rate. The predicted retirement date of the circuit is 10/19/2055.
There are 0 caution TMLs per the current thickness reading taken on 04/19/12.
API 570 Visual Inspection:
Visual inspection found this piping circuit to be in good condition. Line is fully supported with light surface rust on the supports. Casing was found on the pipe approximately 6É?ù below the soil to air interface. No pipewrap was found and should be used at the soil to air interface. Surface rust was found on the welds and heat affected zones. All bolting was secure, gaskets are in place and valves are in good operating condition. The line was found operating at approximately 5 to 70 PSI and the gauges are in good condition. 5 stabilizers were found to be good condition. The piping was inspected for code compliance issues and to identify possible leaks, stresses and any condition that might reduce the life of the piping circuit. All piping will be put on a maximum 5 year thickness inspection interval per API (class _ piping) requirements. Some piping TML locations may require re-inspection prior to the maximum interval. Comments:
Ultrasonic A-Scan Thickness Inspection:
Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness measurements were completed in accordance with Applus RTD ‚Äì Valley Industrial X-Ray established procedures. 30 thickness measurement locations (TMLs) were established and thickness measurements were taken at these locations. An Olympus 38 Plus using a D-790 transducer was used for examining this circuit. One location was found outside the 12.5% tolerance for new piping. This location is TML 3 on the 90¬∞ fittings and the thickness reading recorded is 0.174‚Äù. 12.5% of 0.218‚Äù is 0.190‚Äù. This is a reference to the customer and future inspectors inspecting this line that this fitting was built thin and no corrosion or pitting is associated. This location does not need replacement.
All thickness readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data next inspection will be 06/22/2022 based on a default 2 mill corrosion rate. The predicted retirement date of the circuit is 12/22/2044.
There are 0 caution TMLs per the current thickness reading taken on 06/22/2012.
API 570 Visual Inspection:
Visual inspection found this piping circuit to be in fair condition. Two steam leaks were found on threaded fittings near the casing. Thermal expansion is causing pipe deflection at TML 12. The support shoe has lifted and the pipe is bending. Surface rust was found around welds, insulation interfaces & support shoes. Insulation is in good condition and seals are intact. The piping was inspected for code compliance issues and to identify possible leaks, stresses and any condition that might reduce the life of the piping circuit. All piping will be put on a maximum 10 year thickness inspection interval per API (class 3 piping) requirements. Some piping TML locations may require re-inspection prior to the maximum interval. See UltraPIPE data reports for all required inspection dates.
All piping will require an API 570 Visual inspection in 10 years.
UltraPipe Unit ID MAINCAMP
UltraPipe Circuit ID WELL_H-6_FL

Report(s):
{rsfiles path=""data/main_camp/api570/cvr_lines/well_f-3_cvr/2012/maincamp_well_f-3_cvr_report_062612.pdf""}
{rsfiles path=""data/main_camp/api570/cvr_lines/well_f-3_cvr/2012/maincamp_well_f-3_cvr_ultrapipe_062612.pdf""}

Comments:
Ultrasonic A-Scan Thickness Inspection:
Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness measurements were completed in accordance with Applus RTD ‚Äì Valley Industrial
X-Ray established procedures. Olympus 38 DL Plus with a D-791 RM search unit in standard mode, 5 thickness measurement locations (TMLs) were established and thickness measurements were taken at these locations.
All thickness readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data next inspection will be 03/26/2020 based on a default 2 mil corrosion rate. The predicted retirement date of the circuit is 12/26/2027.
There are 0 caution TMLs per the current thickness reading taken on 06/26/2012.
API 570 Visual Inspection:
Visual inspection found this piping circuit to be in fair condition. Arc strikes were found on the pipe just above the support shoe. Light surface rust was found at welds, heat affected zones & support shoes. The piping was inspected for code compliance issues and to identify possible leaks, stresses and any condition that might reduce the life of the piping circuit. All piping will be put on a maximum 10 year thickness inspection interval per API (class 2 piping) requirements. Some piping TML locations may require re-inspection prior to the maximum interval. See UltraPIPE data reports for all required inspection dates.
All piping will require an API 570 Visual inspection in 5 years.
UltraPipe Unit ID MAINCAMP
UltraPipe Circuit ID WELL_F-3_CVR

An Olympus 38 Plus using a D-790 transducer was used for examining this circuit. One location was found below the 12.5% tolerance given to new fittings. API 570 Visual Inspection:
Visual inspection found this piping circuit to be in fair condition. This piping circuit is 80 % insulated and found to be in fair condition with no missing sheeting are insulation exposed. In areas where inspection port were installed they is no present of CUI found. There is 20 % of this piping circuit is not coated. This 20 % of piping is cover with light to moderate surface rust. No visual external corrosion or pitting was found. Noted there is a pile of oily dirt next to this piping circuit and being push into the piping by a backhoe and covering the insulated on the piping. This piping is supported by steel structure support and in fair condition. No visual corrosion are pitting was found on piping supports There are no shoes attached to this piping. Comments:
Ultrasonic A-Scan Thickness Inspection:
Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness survey was completed in accordance with ApplusRTD established procedures. All thickness readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data next inspection will be 07/17/2018. The predicted retirement date of the circuit is 07/21/2020 based on calculated corrosion rates with a default 2 mil per year rate. There are 2 caution TMLs per the current thickness survey taken on 07/13/2016. Caution TMLs are due to high corrosion rates.
API 570 Visual Inspection:
Visual inspection found this piping circuit to be in fair condition and fit for service. Kraft Well #5-21 is set on rotating intervals and was in service at time of this inspection. The exterior surface is partially insulated and found to be in poor condition with damages are missing insulation and the exposed surface was covered with light to moderate surface rust. Recommend repair damaged are missing insulation and coat exterior surface to protect piping from external corrosion. Note some section of the piping circuit was covered with heavy vegetation and soil build-up and could not be inspected at this time .See photo on pages 10 &11. Recommend remove all vegetation and soil build-up away from the piping and re-inspected those areas. All bolted flanges and threaded connection are free of any leakage or corrosion present. All piping supports are in place and visible look to be in sound condition with no significant problem. The piping was inspected for code compliance issues and to identify possible leaks, stresses and any condition that might reduce the life of the piping circuit. This is a re-inspection and Under Linn Energy new pipeline management plan this piping circuit will be (class 1) and the inspection interval - half the remaining life as determined by corrosion rate calculation, or 5 years- whichever less. Some piping TML locations may require re-inspection prior to the maximum interval. See Ultra PIPE data reports for all required inspection date.
All piping will require an API 570 Visual inspection in 5 years.

Comments:
Ultrasonic A-Scan Thickness Inspection:
Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness measurements were performed on the shell and roof, nozzles.
All readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data next inspection date will be 08/22/2017. The predicted retirement date of the tank is 02/07/2031 based on a 2 mil a year default corrosion rate. Retirement date is an average of the earliest 10% of all TML retirement dates for this equipment. There are 0 caution TML locations per the current thickness reading taken 08/22/2012. The next thickness survey will be time based at 5 years to establish a corrosion rate.
API 653 External Inspection:
External inspection found this tank to be in fair condition. The external shell is coated and found to be in fair condition. The coating on this tank is stained from oily product leaking out from gasket seams. There is no visible evidence of external corrosion are pitting found on this tank. Noted on the bottom 1st ring there is a couple areas found visibly leaking around the seams and calcium build up that indicating possible gasket failure see photo for location. On the 3rd ring at the top between roof and 3rd ring, indentations are present. The tank foundation is a crushed rock ring with steel retaining wall. This retaining wall is in poor condition. Some areas Could not be inspected due to heavy soil built up around the retaining wall. There is light Soil buildup found in rock bed and covering the chime. All nozzles and man ways were found free of any leakage at time of this inspection. Noted there is standing water in the clean out area of this tank.
The roof access stair way is visually securely attached to the tank and constructed out of galvanized steel. The roof is coated and there is no evident of corrosion, pitting visible found. There is evidence of leakage from the roof deck plate gasket from stain. Up-close inspection of the tank roof was not completed due to limited access.
Recommendations: Remove excess soil built up in rock bed and around retaining ring and restore rock rind with clean rock. Replace damaged plate gasket and check boiling torque as necessary. Pump standing water out by tank clean out to verify where the leak is coming from. The next external visual inspection will be time based at 5 years.
API 653 Internal Inspection:
Internal inspection was not scheduled at the time of this inspection. Internal inspection is recommended at the next planned shutdown.

Comments:
Ultrasonic A-Scan Thickness Inspection:
Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness survey was completed in accordance with ApplusRTD established procedures. All thickness readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data next inspection will be 01/04/2020. The predicted retirement date of the circuit is 06/27/2023 based on calculated corrosion rates with a default 2 mil per year rate. There is 1 caution TML per the current thickness survey taken on 07/12/2016.
API 570 Visual Inspection:
Visual inspection found this piping circuit to be in fair condition and fit for service. Highway Well #6-22 is set on rotating intervals and was in service at time of this inspection. The exterior surface is partially insulated and found to be in poor condition with damages are missing insulation and the exposed surface was covered with light to moderate surface rust. Recommend repair damaged are missing insulation and coat exterior surface to protect piping from external corrosion. Note some section of the piping circuit was covered with heavy vegetation and soil build-up and could not be inspected at this time .See photo on pages 10 &11. Recommend remove all vegetation and soil build-up away from the piping and re-inspected those areas .All bolted flanges and threaded connection are free of any leakage or corrosion present. All piping supports are in place and visible look to be in sound condition with no significant problem. The piping was inspected for code compliance issues and to identify possible leaks, stresses and any condition that might reduce the life of the piping circuit. This is a re-inspection and Under Linn Energy new pipeline management plan this piping circuit will be (class 1) and the inspection interval - half the remaining life as determined by corrosion rate calculation, or 5 years- whichever less. Some piping TML locations may require re-inspection prior to the maximum interval. See Ultra PIPE data reports for all required inspection date.
All piping will require an API 570 Visual inspection in 5 years.

The predicted retirement date of the tank is 09/20/2030 based on a 2 mil a year default corrosion rate. Retirement date is an average of the earliest 10% of all TML retirement dates for this equipment. There are 0 caution TML locations per the current thickness reading taken 05/17/2011.
API 653 External Inspection:
External inspection found this tank to be in fair condition. The tank foundation is a crushed rock ring and is in good condition with minor oil buildup under the sample box. The rock fill is good and no cavities were found. No vegetation or other flammable debris was found around the tank exterior. The bottom to shell joint was in good condition. No bulges or other deformations were found on in the shell plates. No leaks were found in the shell joints however a 4‚Äù nozzle is leaking at the attachment to the shell.

The lining was repaired prior to inspection. The roof support ladder is not attached to the tank floor. No corrosion or pitting was noted in the shell wall; however, there was some coating failure and rusting present in the upper portion of the shell and on the underside of the roof. The autogauge system was found disconnected at this time. Internal piping is supported and anchored to the floor and is in good condition.

Inspection Dates:
Last: 07/02/2012
Next: 06/28/2017
Inspector: Brandon Meadows
Report(s):
{rsfiles path=""data/main_camp/api570/gas_lines/2012/maincamp_gas_lines_report_062812.pdf""}
{rsfiles path=""data/main_camp/api570/gas_lines/2012/maincamp_gas-lines_ultrapipe_062812.pdf""}
{rsfiles path=""data/main_camp/api570/gas_lines/2012/maincamp_gas_lines_field-drawing_062812.pdf""}
Comments:
Ultrasonic A-Scan Thickness Inspection:
Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness measurements were completed in accordance with Applus RTD É?? Valley Industrial
X-Ray established procedures. Olympus 38 DL Plus with a D-791 RM search unit in standard mode. GL-200 (19 readings recorded) GL-1000 (41 readings recorded). Thickness measurement locations (TMLs) were established and thickness measurements were taken at these locations.
All thickness readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data next inspection will be 06/28/2017 based on 2 mill default corrosion rate. The predicted retirement date of the circuit is 05/08/2028.
There are 0 caution TMLs per the current thickness reading taken on 07-02-2012.
API 570 Visual Inspection:
Visual inspection found this piping circuit to be in fair condition. Noticeable defects were found open to the surface on three welds. Customer is aware of the defects and the welds were flagged for repairs. These defects include open cluster porosity, pin hole and cold lap or lack of fusion to the base material. These locations are TML 27 vertical weld, TML 34 vertical weld, and the tee of the line directly feeding the generator. There is no definite way of determining the depth of the above defects without the use of Shear Wave. They can be removed by a grinding down the material until the defect is gone then replace any weld metal that has been removed. Magnetic particle, Penetrate testing, visual or x-ray can be used as a follow up recheck. Numerous arc strikes were found near the welds and support shoes between TML 11 & 12 and on the branched connection line to the generator. Arc strikes from welders should be eliminated as much as possible due to the fact that microscopic cracks could be induced into the pipe and could escalate in the right conditions to line failure. This inspection also found that the line is currently under a nitrogen purge at 230 PSI. The PSV associated with this line is set at 200 PSI with the inlet block valves closed and no car seals. Be sure to depressurize below 200 PSI before opening inlet block valves. Light surface rust was found at welds, heat affected zones & support shoes. Line is fully supported and all bolts and gaskets are installed. The piping was inspected for code compliance issues and to identify possible leaks, stresses and any condition that might reduce the life of the piping circuit. All piping will be put on a maximum 5 year thickness inspection interval per API (class 2 piping) requirements. Some piping TML locations may require re-inspection prior to the maximum interval. See UltraPIPE data reports for all required inspection dates.
All piping will require an API 570 Visual inspection in 5 years.
UltraPipe Unit ID MAINCAMP
UltraPipe Circuit ID GL-200, GL-1000

Comments:
Ultrasonic A-Scan Thickness Inspection
Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness measurements were completed in accordance with Applus RTD ‚Äì Valley Industrial
X-Ray established procedures. 49 thickness measurement locations (TMLs) were established and thickness measurements were taken at these locations.
All thickness readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data next inspection will be 06/13/2022 based on a default 2 mil per year corrosion rate. The predicted retirement date of the circuit is 12/13/2057.
There are 0 caution TMLs per the current thickness reading taken on 06/13/2012.
API 570 Visual Inspection
Visual inspection found this piping circuit to be in fair condition. The well is reactivated utilizing new and old existing piping. No access was permitted near the well. All areas visually inspected were outside the perimeter barricade. Piping has surface rust around welds, heat affected zones, support shoes, bolting, and insulation interfaces. Some scale & C.U.I was found inside damaged areas of insulation. Insulation seals are failing. New insulation was installed but still some small areas have insulation interfaces which are leaving the pipe exposed. Just before the last road crossing the insulated pipe travels beneath the soil. This area may lead to damaged insulation if any standing water should occur. The piping was inspected for code compliance issues and to identify possible leaks, stresses and any condition that might reduce the life of the piping circuit. All piping will be put on a maximum 10 year thickness inspection interval per API (class 3 piping) requirements. Some piping TML locations may require re-inspection prior to the maximum interval. See UltraPIPE data reports for all required inspection dates.
All piping will require an API 570 Visual inspection in 10 years.
UltraPipe Unit ID BELGIAN
UltraPipe Circuit ID WELL_29-21R_FL

Inspector: Ronnie Harleston
Report(s):
INSPECTION REPORT
2.65 MB
ULTRAPIPE DATA REPORT
61.28 KB
FIELD DRAWING
1.14 MB
Comments:
As of 12/04/2012 this line has been taken out of service per Tye Hammond.
Ultrasonic A-Scan Thickness Inspection:
Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness measurements were completed in accordance with Applus RTD É?? Valley Industrial
X-Ray established procedures. 66 Thickness measurement locations (TMLs) were established and thickness measurements were taken at these locations. All thickness readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data next inspection date cannot be established due to TMLs below t-min. Since no structural t-min has been established by Berry Petroleum, an arbitrary t-min has been set at 60% of the nominal wall making t-min for 8É?ù sch 40 to be .193. Pressure t-min calculations are based on the flange rating for the lowest class flange on this line (150#). Pressure T-min of .056É?ù was calculated for 8É?ù pipe. Due to Structural Requirements (percent of nominal thickness), T-Min for 8É?ù = .193É?ù. There are 10 thickness readings below t-min with the lowest reading recorded as .123É?ù at TML 25.
API 570 Visual Inspection:
Visual inspection found this piping circuit to be in fair condition. The piping only has the factory coating applied and is in poor condition with surface rusting scattered throughout. There is no evidence of external corrosion or pitting found at this time. Some areas of this piping circuit are buried in the soil and in some area the soil was removed with no visual evidence of soil to air interface corrosion found. There is visual evidence of old leakage found between TML # 8 and TML # 9 on this piping circuit from external scale build-up and low UT survey in this area. The reading in that area is in the low .150É??É??. From ultrasonic A-scan thickness measurements there is significant wall loss due to internal corrosion on this piping circuit. See Ultrapipe data report for detail. The piping is sitting on concrete blocks and soil has built up around the supports and pipe in some locations. Removal of soil buildup in some areas revealed no significant corrosion. One pressure gauge was found not serviceable. The PSV was last serviced 04/21/2003.
Recommendations: Conduct engineering review of this line to determine design t-min. Replace sections of piping degraded below t-min. Service PSV. Complete baseline thickness survey on new piping and re-inspect in 1-2 years to determine a corrosion rate.
UltraPipe Unit ID HOMEBASE
UltraPipe Circuit ID
-PW-100

{rsfiles path=""data/placerita/gpm/api570/flow_lines/well_105/2012/pl-gpm_well-105_ultrapipe_060713.pdf""}
{rsfiles path=""data/placerita/gpm/api570/flow_lines/well_105/2012/pl-gpm_well-105_field-drawing_060713.pdf""}
Comments:
Ultrasonic A-Scan Thickness Inspection:
Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness measurements were completed in accordance with Applus RTD É?? Valley Industrial
X-Ray established procedures. 51 Thickness measurement locations (TMLs) were established and thickness measurements were taken at these locations. 51 thickness locations were inspected 9/13/2012 and 1 thickness location was added and inspected 06/07/2013 on the well casing. All thickness readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data next inspection will be 09/13/2017. The predicted retirement date of the circuit is 09/01/2051 based on a 2 mil per year default corrosion rate. There are 0 caution TMLs per the current thickness reading taken on 09/13/2012 & 06/07/2013.
API 570 External Visual Inspection:
Visual inspection found this piping circuit to be in fair condition. This piping circuit is insulated and the insulation was found to be in fair condition with no missing sheeting or bulging at this time. No visual evidence of leakage was found on this piping circuit. In areas were inspection ports are installed there is light to moderate surface rust present no pitting or corrosion found. The piping is supported by steel structure support and found in fair condition. No corrosion or pitting was found on piping supports. There are no shoes found on this piping. This piping circuit was found resting on top of the pipe support.
All piping will require an API 570 Visual inspection in 5 years.
Recommendations: None at this time.
UltraPipe Unit ID PL-GPM
UltraPipe Circuit ID WELL-105

Comments:
Ultrasonic A-Scan Thickness Inspection:
Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness measurements were completed in accordance with Applus RTD É?? Valley Industrial
X-Ray established procedures. Thickness measurement locations (TMLs) were established and thickness measurements were taken at these locations: PW-100, PWI-100, PW-101, PW-102 & PF-200. All thickness readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data next inspection will be 10/05/2016 based on default 2 mils per year. The earliest predicted retirement date of the circuit is 11/13/2047.
Update 07/02/12: An injection point (PW-100-I) was located on the PW-100 line near TML 19. Thickness readings were taken according to API 570 injection point monitoring requirements.
The next injection circuit inspection date will be 07/02/2015. Injection points will be on a 3 year inspection interval.
There are 0 caution TMLs per the current thickness reading taken on 10-07-2011.
API 570 Visual Inspection:
Visual inspection found this piping circuit in fair condition. Surface rust was found on the pipe, welds, heat affected zones & pipe supports. All bolting is fully engaged with moderate surface rust. Soil-to-air interfaces were found at random locations where the pipe is in contact with the soil. These areas should be wrapped or the soil beneath should be removed to provide clearance for any standing water. Line number PF-200 should be reinsulated due to the amount of damaged insulation. Insulation interfaces contain surface rust. Consider coating the entire circuit to minimize the external corrosion. The piping was inspected for code compliance issues and to identify possible leaks, stresses and any condition that might reduce the life of the piping circuit. All piping will be put on a maximum 5 year thickness inspection interval per API (class 3 piping) requirements. Some piping TML locations may require re-inspection prior to the maximum interval. See UltraPIPE data reports for all required inspection dates.
All piping will require an API 570 Visual inspection in 5 years
UltraPipe Unit ID BELGIAN
UltraPipe Circuit ID PW-100, PW-100-I, PW-101, PW-102, PF-200

Comments:
Ultrasonic A-Scan Inspection:
Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness measurements were performed on shell and nozzles.
All readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data next inspection will be 9/10/2017. The predicted retirement date of the vessel is 12/20/2040 based on a 2 mil a year default corrosion rate.
There are 0 caution tml locations per the current thickness reading taken 9/12/2012. The next thickness survey will be time based at 5 years.
API 510 External Inspection:
External inspection found this to be a new vessel and installation is not completed at this time. The coating is in good condition. This is a vertical vessel and is supported by 4 legs. There are no anchors bolting attached to the concrete foundation to securely fasten this vessel at the time of inspection. The concrete foundation for this vessel was found to be in good condition and free of any spalling. All bolted flange connection; Stainless steel bolting was installed and appears securely fastened. No vertical ladder or platform was attached to this vessel. The next visual inspection will be time based at 5 years.
Recommendation: Re-inspected this vessel went installation is completed to verify all bolting are in place and securely fastened to this vessel.
API 510 Internal Inspection:
Internal inspection was not completed during this inspection. The next internal inspection will be time based at 10 years.

{rsfiles path=""data/main_camp/api570/soft_water_lines/2012/maincamp_soft-water-piping_ultrapipe_073112.pdf""}
{rsfiles path=""data/main_camp/api570/soft_water_lines/2012/maincamp_soft-water-piping_field-drawing_073112.PDF""}
Comments:
Ultrasonic A-Scan Thickness Inspection:
Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness measurements were completed in accordance with Applus RTD É?? Valley Industrial
X-Ray established procedures. Olympus 38 DL Plus with a D-791 RM search unit in standard mode. SW-1005 (23 readings recorded) SW-500 (8 readings recorded), SW-501 (6 readings recorded), SW-502 (9 readings recorded), SW-503 (20 readings recorded), SW-504 (8 readings recorded), SW-505 (13 readings recorded), SW-506 (12 readings recorded), SW-507 (37 readings recorded) & SW-508 (6 readings recorded). Thickness measurement locations (TMLs) were established and thickness measurements were taken at those locations. Multiple locations were found below the allowed 12.5% tolerance given to new fittings and pipe. These locations and drawings are as follows: SW-502 TML 1, SW-503 TML 15, SW-505 TML 3, 7 & 13, SW-506 TML 11, SW-507 and TML 12 & 16. The low thickness readings do not appear to be caused by internal corrosion and are most likely caused by fabrication under-run. An external grinder mark was found on the 90?¯ elbow fitting at SW-508 TML 3 and a thickness of 0.176É?ù was recorded at this location.
All thickness readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data next inspection will be 07/31/2017 based on 2 mill default corrosion rate. The predicted retirement date of the circuit is 06/26/2029.
There are 0 caution TMLs per the current thickness reading taken on 07/31/2012.
API 570 Visual Inspection:
Visual inspection found this piping circuit to be in good condition. Line SW-505 is currently disconnected at the generator. The generator is using a temporary PVC line for water. Light surface rust was found at welds, heat affected zones & support shoes. Temporary wood supports are being utilized until permanent shoes are installed. The piping was inspected for code compliance issues and to identify possible leaks, stresses and any condition that might reduce the life of the piping circuit. All piping will be put on a maximum 5 year thickness inspection interval per API (class 2 piping) requirements. Some piping TML locations may require re-inspection prior to the maximum interval. See UltraPIPE data reports for all required inspection dates.
All piping will require an API 570 Visual inspection in 5 years.
UltraPipe Unit ID MAINCAMP
UltraPipe Circuit ID SW-500, SW-501, SW-502, SW-503, SW-504, SW-504, SW-506, SW-507, SW-508, SW-1005

Field: PAN FEE
Location: NMWSS
Equipment ID: A Train Polisher
Inspection Dates:
Last: 10/31/2012
Next: 10/31/2017
Inspector: James Reese
Report(s):
{rsfiles path=""data/pan_fee/water_plant/api510/a_train_polisher/2012/panfee_a-train-polisher_report_103112.pdf""}
{rsfiles path=""data/pan_fee/water_plant/api510/a_train_polisher/2012/panfee_a-train-polisher_ultrapipe_103112.pdf""}
{rsfiles path=""data/pan_fee/water_plant/api510/a_train_polisher/2012/panfee_a-train-polisher_field-drawing_103112.pdf""}
{rsfiles path=""data/pan_fee/water_plant/api510/a_train_polisher/2012/panfee_a-train-polisher_u1a_103112.pdf""}
Comments:
Ultrasonic A-Scan Thickness Inspection:
Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness measurements were performed on shell and nozzles. All readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data next inspection will be 10/31/2017. The predicted retirement date of the vessel is 04/19/2030 based on a 2 mil a year default corrosion rate. There are 0 caution tml locations per the current thickness reading taken 10/31/2012. The next thickness survey will be time based at 5 years. Scanning was completed on the external shell on the north side to determine the lowest thickness in the area of worst pitting. The lowest reading recorded was .292É?ù, which is above the t-min of .282É?ù.
API 570 Visual Inspection:
External inspection found the vessel to be in good condition. The data plate was attached to the shell on the north west side of the vessel and an alteration plate and repair plate were attached directly above the data plate. The data plate was faded but still legible. The foundation is a concrete pad with integrated drainage and is in good condition. The vessel is supported by 4 I-Beam type legs attached to the head and shell and welded to a steel skid. The external shell, heads and nozzles are in good condition with no signs of external corrosion, pitting, bulging or other deformations. The paint coating on the external surfaces was in good condition with some minor fading and small areas of chipping noted. There are no access ways installed on or around this vessel. Scaffolding was erected to facilitate an internal inspection. The PSV was not accessible for inspection due to the scaffolding partially blocking access. The vessel is grounded through the skid structure.
API 510 Internal Inspection:
Internal inspection was completed from the top and bottom manway openings to achieve a 100% internal inspection. The vessel was opened and cleaned prior to entry. The sprayer ladders were left inside the vessel during inspection. Internal surfaces were covered with moderate pitting ranging 1/8É?ù to 1/4"" diameter and up to .100É?ù in depth. The most severe pitting was noted on the north half of the vessel. Average pit depth is .050É?ù to .070É?ù deep. Due to the amount of pitting present, pitting was measured randomly at locations appearing to be the worst. All pitting found was beneath the coating indicating that there is no new pitting since the internal coating was applied. All internal pitting is of acceptable size and depth at this time and no repairs are required.
Internal surfaces appear to have been coated at least twice. The second coating is peeling away from the first coating in several places; the first coating is still intact at this time. Several areas of coating were found damaged which appears to be caused by welding to the external shell. These areas have been marked with yellow marker. The coating on the bottom head appears to have failed around the media tray weld and rusting can be seen. No significant pitting was revealed in the bottom portion of this vessel at this time. All internal welds were in good condition and had full profile. Media tray support stays have broken away from the bottom head allowing the bottom plate to flex.
Recommendations: Sandblast and re-inspect internals. Recoat vessel internals or repair damaged coating as marked. Repair damaged media tray support stays.
UltraPipe Unit ID PAN FEE
UltraPipe Circuit ID A-TRAIN POLISHER

Comments:
Ultrasonic A-Scan Thickness Inspection:
Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness measurements were completed in accordance with Applus RTD É?? Valley Industrial
X-Ray established procedures. 27 Thickness measurement locations (TMLs) were established and thickness measurements were taken at these locations. 27 thickness locations were inspected 09/12/2012 and 1 thickness location was added and inspected 06/05/2013 on the well casing. All thickness readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data next inspection will be 09/12/2016. The predicted retirement date of the circuit is 09/12/2020 based on a 2 mil per year default corrosion rate. Low remaining life is due to low thickness readings at TMLs 13 through 27. There are 0 caution TMLs per the current thickness reading taken on 09/12/2012 & 06/05/2013.
Low thickness readings were found on TMLs 13 through 27. Thickness at these TMLs is consistent with Schedule 40 pipe. It is unknown at this time if the low thickness readings are from corrosion or if the line was constructed with schedule 40 pipe and fittings at these locations.
API 570 External Visual Inspection:
Visual inspection found this piping circuit to be in fair condition. This piping circuit is insulated and the insulation was found to be in fair condition with some missing sheeting and the insulation wool exposed. One area is next to a clamp that has been installed to repair a leak on the piping. No other visual evidence of leakage was found on this piping circuit. In areas where insulation is missing there is light to moderate surface rust present no pitting or corrosion found. The piping is supported by steel structure support and support chains found in fair condition. No corrosion pitting was found on piping supports. There are some areas found that have shoes on this piping and the shoes look visibly securely attached to this piping and found resting on top of the pipe support. Noted TML 13 thought TML 27 there is evidence of moderate wall loss see thickness survey report.
All piping will require an API 570 Visual inspection in 5 years.
Recommendations: Repair or replace missing and damaged insulation. Replace section of pipe with the clamp installed. Investigate the cause of low thickness readings at TMLs 13 through 27.

Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness measurements were completed in accordance with Applus RTD established procedures. 139 thickness measurement locations (TMLs) were established and thickness measurements were taken at these locations.\t\t\t\t

\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t
API 570 Visual Inspection: \t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t
Some sections of the piping could not be inspected due to heavy buildup of vegetation and soil. Visual inspection found this piping circuit to be in fair condition. This piping circuit external surface is covered with light to moderate brown surface rust. In some section of the piping it was found to be insulated and in poor condition. In some areas the sheeting was missing are loose at road crossing and a section running over a small valley. In some areas due to the natural of the environment there is soil wash down from the hill side and covering piping with dirt soil. In some areas the dirt soil was extracted around the piping and founding a rust scale built up around the piping no visual evident of external corrosion are pitting found on this piping circuit at this time. All piping support were found to be in place and in fair condition. All bolted flange connection was free of any leakage or corrosion. The piping was inspected for code compliance issues and to identify possible leaks, stresses and any condition that might reduce the life of the piping circuit. All piping will be put on a one year thickness inspection interval per API customer. Some piping TML locations may require re-inspection prior to the maximum interval. See UltraPIPE data reports for all required inspection dates.\t\t\t\t
Recommendation: Repair or replace insulation in the needed areas that requires attention. ExcavatorÉ??s soil around the piping and re inspected those areas for corrosion or external pitting.
\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t
All piping will require an API 570 Visual inspection in 5 years.\t\t\t

Comments:
Ultrasonic A-Scan Thickness Survey:
Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness measurements were performed on the shell and roof, nozzles.
All readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data next inspection date will be. The predicted retirement date of the tank is based on a 2 mil a year default corrosion rate. Retirement date is an average of the earliest 10% of all TML retirement dates for this equipment. There are 0 caution TML locations per the current thickness reading taken. The next thickness survey will be time based at 5 years to establish a corrosion rate.
API 653 External Inspection:
External inspection found this tank to be in good condition. The external shell is insulated and found to be in good condition. With no missing sheeting are any other insulation failures found doing this inspection. There is no visible evidence of external corrosion found on this tank. The tank foundation is a concrete pad and in fair condition. This concrete pad was found to have light hair cracking and chipping in areas and no spalling was found. Noted there was exiting anchor bolts or suck rods from prevent tank that had been installed on this foundation. The exiting anchors bolts or suck rods were cut off and bent over causing slight damage to the concrete pad. All nozzles and man ways were found free of any leakage at time of this inspection. There is a 4É??É?? nozzle on the east side at bottom of this tank with a slight sagging due to excess weight from attached piping. No ground cable was found attached to this tank at the time of inspection. Noted there is a cathodic protection system installed on this tank.
Recommendation: Add a piping support for 4É??É?? nozzle. Attach a ground cable to this tank.The roof access stair way and ladder are visually securely attached to the tank and constructed out of carbon steel. The roof is coated and there is no evident of corrosion, pitting visible found. There is no evident of leakage from the roof deck plate gasket. Up-close inspection of the tank roof was not completed due to limited access. There is no sag noted on roof.
API 653 Internal Inspection :
No internal inspection was performed at this time.

Comments:
Ultrasonic A-Scan Inspection:
Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness measurements were performed on shell and nozzles. All readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data next inspection will be 08/27/2017. The predicted retirement date of the vessel is 07/27/2068 based on a 2 mil a year default corrosion rate. There are 0 caution tml locations per the current thickness reading taken 08/27/2012. The next thickness survey will be time based at 5 years. This is the first inspection of this new vessel. The vessel has not yet been placed into service. The UT thickness readings collected during this inspection will serve as the baseline for corrosion calculations.
API 510 External Inspection:
External inspection found the vessel to be in new condition. The vessel is supported by 4 I-Beam type legs bolted to a skid resting on a concrete foundation. The vessel is grounded through the skid. The shell, heads and nozzles are all in good condition. The paint coating is in good condition. There appears to be no damage to the shell, heads or nozzles as a result of transportation and installation. The vessel is securely installed into its service location and skid piping is attached to the nozzles and all nozzle bolting is secure. The skid piping is not attached to any water plant piping at this time.
Update 05/13/2016:
Follow-up inspection to verify that a PSV has been installed. PSV installed on the top head and is set at 125 PSI. No further action required at this time.
Recommendations: None.
API 510 Internal Inspection:
Internal inspection was not completed during this inspection. Internal inspection will be due in 10 years.
UltraPipe Unit ID HOMEBASE
UltraPipe Circuit ID WAC-400

Comments:
Ultrasonic A-Scan Thickness Inspection:
Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness measurements were completed in accordance with Applus RTD established procedures. 107 Thickness measurement locations (TMLs) were established and thickness measurements were taken at these locations.
All thickness readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data next inspection will be 11/12/2017 based on a 2 mill a year default corrosion rate. The predicted retirement date of the circuit is 06/26/2021
There are 4 caution TMLs per the current thickness reading taken on 03/31/2014.
API 570 Visual Inspection:
Visual inspection found this piping circuit to be in good condition. This piping circuit was insulated 95% of the piping circuit. This insulation was found to be missing or damage, over it was in fair condition. The coating on the 5% of the piping circuit was found in fair condition with light surface rust and chipping in areas. All Shoes are visible attached and in fair condition on this piping circuit. The pipe supports were found to be in fair condition. Noted some off the pipe supports running long side of the road coming from Header (A) could not be inspected because they were burled with soil up to bottom of insulation. All bolted flange and threaded connection were free of any leakage and the bolting is cover with light surface rust no external corrosion was found at this time. The piping was inspected for code compliance issues and to identify possible leaks, stresses and any condition that might reduce the life of the piping circuit. All piping will be put on a one year thickness inspection interval per customer. Some piping TML locations may require re-inspection prior to the maximum interval. See UltraPIPE data reports for all required inspection dates.
Recommendations: Repair damage insulation are replaced. Remover excess soil around pipe supports and insulation.
UltraPipe Unit ID POSO
UltraPipe Circuit ID GL-NORTH HEADER

Comments: \t\t\t\t
Ultrasonic A-Scan Thickness Survey: \t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t
Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness measurements were performed on the shell and nozzles.\t\t\t\t
All readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data next inspection date will be 08/29/2016. The predicted retirement date of the tank is 08/22/2037 based on a 2 mil a year default corrosion rate. Retirement date is an average of the earliest 10% of all TML retirement dates for this equipment. There are 0 caution TML locations per the current thickness reading taken 08/30/2011.\t\t\t\t
\t\t\t\t
API 653 External Inspection: \t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t
External inspection found this tank to be in good condition. The foundation is a crushed rock ring and is in fair condition with some light soil buildup. The tank shell was in good condition. No leaks were found at the shell plate seams; however, a few bolts from internal baffles and a sample connection were found to have oil seepage. The roof access stairway is in good condition. All nozzles are in good condition and are securely bolted to the tank. A grounding strap was found attached to the tank.\t\t\t\t
\t\t\t\t
API 653 Internal Inspection: \t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t
Internal inspection found this tank to be in good condition. No signs of pitting or corrosion were noted. The tank floor was cleaned prior to entry and was in good condition. The floor coating was in good condition and showed no signs of coating failure. The shell was covered in product buildup at the time of inspection. Some areas were spot cleaned and these areas revealed no corrosion or coating failure. The roof support structure and internal baffle are in good condition. All anodes were in place and in good visual condition.\t\t\t\t
Ultrasonic A-Scan Thickness Survey:\t\t\t\t
Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness measurements were performed on the shell and nozzles.\t\t\t\t
All readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data next inspection date will be 08/29/2016. The predicted retirement date of the tank is 08/22/2037 based on a 2 mil a year default corrosion rate. Retirement date is an average of the earliest 10% of all TML retirement dates for this equipment. There are 0 caution TML locations per the current thickness reading taken 08/30/2011.\t\t\t\t
\t\t\t\t
API 653 External Inspection:\t\t\t\t
External inspection found this tank to be in good condition. The foundation is a crushed rock ring and is in fair condition with some light soil buildup. The tank shell was in good condition. No leaks were found at the shell plate seams; however, a few bolts from internal baffles and a sample connection were found to have oil seepage. The roof access stairway is in good condition. All nozzles are in good condition and are securely bolted to the tank. A grounding strap was found attached to the tank.\t\t\t\t
\t\t\t\t
API 653 Internal Inspection:\t\t\t\t
Internal inspection found this tank to be in good condition. No signs of pitting or corrosion were noted. The tank floor was cleaned prior to entry and was in good condition. The floor coating was in good condition and showed no signs of coating failure. The shell was covered in product buildup at the time of inspection. Some areas were spot cleaned and these areas revealed no corrosion or coating failure. The roof support structure and internal baffle are in good condition. All anodes were in place and in good visual condition.\t\t\t
