Comments: \t\t\t\t
Ultrasonic A-Scan Thickness Inspection: \t\t\t\tUltrasonic A-Scan thickness measurements were completed in accordance with Applus RTD É?? Valley Industrial
X-Ray established procedures. FG-101 (19 readings were recorded), FG-102 (17 readings were recorded), FG-103 (46 readings were recorded), FG-1000 (22 readings were recorded), FG-1001 (46 readings were recorded), FG-1002 (42 readings were recorded) FG-1003 (56 readings were recorded). Thickness measurement locations (TMLs) were established and thickness measurements were taken at these locations. All thickness readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data next inspection will be 06/11/2017 based on a default 2 mill corrosion rate. The predicted retirement date of the circuit is 12/18/2031. There are 0 caution TMLs per the current thickness reading taken on 06/11/2012.\t\t\t\t
API 570 Visual Inspection:
Visual inspection found this piping circuit to be in good condition. Wood support and sagging pipe was found near TML 1 on drawing FG-1000 near Reward Rd. Light surface rust was found at support locations, support shoes, heat affected zones and welds. The piping was inspected for code compliance issues and to identify possible leaks, stresses and any condition that might reduce the life of the piping circuit. All piping will be put on a maximum 5 year thickness inspection interval per API (class 2 piping) requirements. Some piping TML locations may require re-inspection prior to the maximum interval. See UltraPIPE data reports for all required inspection dates. All piping will require an API 570 Visual inspection in 5 years.\t\t\t
UltraPipe Unit ID 21Z
UltraPipe Circuit ID FG-101, FG-102, FG-103, FG-1000, FG-1001, FG-1002, FG-1003

Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness measurements were completed in accordance with Applus RTD É?? Valley Industrial

Thickness measurement locations (TMLs) were established and thickness measurements were taken at these locations. All thickness readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data next inspection will be 08/06/2017 based on a default 2 mill per year corrosion rate. API 570 Visual Inspection :
Visual inspection found this piping circuit to be in good condition. The line is currently out of service due to the relocation of AWTÉ??s to GS-20. Some areas were found open to atmosphere on the 3É?ù & 4É?ù piping. This line was found completely insulated and securely supported. Some insulation seals are open while most are in good condition. Support shoes and shoe brackets are in good condition with surface rust. The piping was inspected for code compliance issues and to identify possible leaks, stresses and any condition that might reduce the life of the piping circuit.
All piping will require an API 570 Visual inspection in 5 years.

An Olympus 38 Plus using a D-790 transducer was used for examining this circuit. All thickness readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data next inspection will be 08/30/2022 based on a default 2 mill corrosion rate. The predicted retirement date of the circuit is 08/31/2058.

API 570 Visual Inspection:
Visual inspection found this piping circuit in good condition. Surface rust was found around welds, insulation interfaces & support shoes. Insulation is in good condition and seals are intact. The piping was inspected for code compliance issues and to identify possible leaks, stresses and any condition that might reduce the life of the piping circuit.
All piping will require an API 570 Visual inspection in 10 years.

Last: 11/19/2012
Next:
OUT OF SERVICE
Inspector: Brandon Meadows
Report(s):
INSPECTION REPORT
905.95 KB
ULTRAPIPE DATA REPORT
59.98 KB
FIELD DRAWING
1.52 MB
Comments:
Ultrasonic A-Scan Inspection:
Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness measurements were performed on shell, nozzles & heads. During the UT inspection, additional scanning was performed. Internal pitting was discovered on the top of the north side reaching an approximate depth of 0.110É?ù on both sides of the manway and the bottom of the north side (S-1). The remaining wall at the S-1 bottom location is approximately 0.182É?ù and the top is 0.206É?ù. T-min is Internal pitting was also discovered in Nozzle 8. The recorded reading for N-8 is 0.190É?ù which is 0.090É?ù wall loss from standard 6É?ù (0.280É?ù). Suggesting a B-scan inspection to be performed to evaluate the areas of interest.
All readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data next inspection will be 11/19/2017.
There are 0 caution tml locations per the current thickness reading taken 11-19-2012. The next thickness survey will be time based at 5 years.
API 510 External Inspection:
External inspection found the vessel to be in fair condition. The PSV set pressure (100 PSI) is set too high for the equipment MAWP (75 PSI). The customer is aware of this. The foundation is completely covered with soil and debris. All nuts were missing from the four anchor bolts used for securing the vessel to the foundation. The saddles have moderate surface at the bottom of each support. Surface rust can be found on the shell, head, nozzles, and support saddles on in all areas of paint failure. No ground cable was found. Oil was found near the top 2É?ù coupling on the south end. Does not appear to have any leaks. The next internal inspection will be time based at 5 years.
API 510 Internal Inspection:
The internal inspection was not completed at this time.
Recommending an Internal inspection or an On-stream inspection to be performed as soon as possible.
UltraPipe Unit ID HOMEBASE
UltraPipe Circuit ID SILVER CONDNST

Comments:
Ultrasonic A-Scan Thickness Inspection:
Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness measurements were completed in accordance with Applus RTD established procedures. 61 thickness measurement locations (TMLs) were established and thickness measurements were taken at these locations. All thickness readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data next inspection will be 06/07/2017. The predicted retirement date of the circuit is 06/04/2022 based on calculated corrosion rates and a 2 mil per year default corrosion rate. There are 2 caution TMLs per the current thickness survey taken on 06/08/2016. Due to high corrosion rates.
API 570 Visual Inspection:
Visual inspection found this piping circuit to be in fair condition. This Group line is insulated and the insulation is found to have damage penetrations and is missing jacketing. The external surface condition on this piping circuit was found to be covered with light to moderate surface rust. No external corrosion was present with the exception of next to TML 52 at the clamp. I recommend changing the small section of piping at the clamp.
There is threaded small bore connections present, with no indication of corrosion or leakage. The flange bolting was intact, with no significant thread or fastener degradation found. Piping supports were structurally sound and no significant problems were found. Two injection points are located on this piping circuit and Demulsifier is being injected into this system. The piping was inspected for code compliance issues and to identify possible leaks, stresses and any condition that might reduce the life of the piping circuit. All piping will be put on a one year thickness inspection interval per customer. Some piping TML locations may require re-inspection prior to the maximum interval. See UltraPIPE data reports for all required inspection dates
Recommendations: replace section of pipe at the clamp with external corrosion and the small leak from the clamp.
All piping will require an API 570 Visual inspection in 5 years.
UltraPipe Unit ID PL-ORWIG
UltraPipe Circuit ID AWT-6 GROUPLINE

Comments:
Ultrasonic A-Scan Thickness Inspection:
Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness measurements were completed in accordance with Applus RTD established procedures. Thickness measurements were taken at the locations previously established. All thickness readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data next inspection will be 01/07/2018. The predicted retirement date of the circuit is 02/05/2020 based on calculated corrosion rates and a 2 mil per year default corrosion rate. There are 4 caution TMLs per the current thickness reading taken on 12/10/2015. Caution TMLs are due to high corrosion rates.
API 570 Visual Inspection:
Visual inspection found this piping circuit to be in good condition. Piping circuit was found to be in service at time of inspection. Light to moderate surface rust was found at welds, heat affected zones & support shoes. Pressure gauges and temperature were in good condition. Insulation on line was in fair condition and in some places, the insulation sheeting is damaged and coming apart. Around TML 70 and 71, there is a large area of soil erosion which could indicate an underground leak on this circuit or one of the other circuits at this location. Recommend excavating in this area and inspect piping for leaks.
The piping was inspected for code compliance issues and to identify possible leaks, stresses and any condition that might reduce the life of the piping circuit. All piping will be put on a maximum 10 year thickness inspection interval per API (class 3 piping) requirements. Some piping TML locations may require re-inspection prior to the maximum interval. See UltraPIPE data reports for all required inspection dates.
All piping will require an API 570 Visual inspection in 10 years.
UltraPipe Unit ID POSO
UltraPipe Circuit ID N GATHERING LN 2

The predicted retirement date of the circuit is 08/19/2020 based on a default 2 mil per year corrosion rate. There is 1 caution TML per the current thickness survey taken on 07/01/2016.
API 570 Visual Inspection
Visual inspection found this piping circuit to be in good condition. This piping circuit was in service at time of inspection. The majority of the insulation on this piping circuit is in good condition. There are multiple areas missing jacketing and having damage and penetrations. Light surface rust was found at the welds and their heat affected zones and at support shoes in the areas that had missing insulation. There are 3 injections points on this line injecting a clarifier, a de-emulsifier, and an antifoaming agent. TML‚Äôs were taken at these locations. The field drawing shows these locations. The piping was inspected for code compliance issues and to identify possible leaks, stresses and any condition that might reduce the life of the piping circuit. All piping will be put on a one year thickness inspection interval per customer request. Some piping TML locations may require re-inspection prior to the maximum interval. See UltraPIPE data reports for all required inspection dates.
All piping will require an API 570 Visual inspection in 10 years.
UltraPipe Unit ID POSO
UltraPipe Circuit ID S GATHERING LINE

Inspector: Brandon Meadows
Report(s):
INSPECTION REPORT
735.81 KB
ULTRAPIPE DATA REPORT
60.49 KB
FIELD DRAWING
1.51 MB
Comments:
Ultrasonic A-Scan Thickness Survey:
Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness measurements were performed on the floor and externally on the shell and roof. A-Scan readings were performed using an Olympus 38 DL Plus with a D-791-RM search unit utilizing echo-echo mode to receive true wall readings through paint. All thickness readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data next inspection date will be 10/31/2017. The predicted retirement date of the tank is 9/9/2031 based on a 2 mil a year default corrosion rate. Retirement date is an average of the earliest 10% of all TML retirement dates for this equipment.
There are 0 caution TML locations per the current thickness reading taken 10/31/2012 for the shell and floor. Next thickness survey will be time based at 5 years to establish a corrosion rate.
API 653 External Inspection:
External inspection found this tank to be in good condition. This tank is not complete and is still under construction. The roof is in good condition. No pressure/thermal relieving devices were found. The paint on the roof is in good condition with all gaskets and bolting secure. The external paint coating on the shell is in good condition. The tank foundation is a crushed rock ring with a steel retaining wall. The retaining wall is in sound condition and secure. No soil buildup was found around the chime. All vertical & horizontal bolted seams were in good condition. No ground cable was found.
API 653 Internal Inspection:
Internal inspection has found the tank in good condition. The floor, roof and shell plates have new paint and new bolting with plastic bolt protector caps. All floor plate bolted seams are in good condition. The rafters appear in good condition.
Recommendations:
A re-check of the inspection should be completed after the tank has been in service to ensure no leaks are found.
UltraPipe Unit ID BOGP
UltraPipe Circuit ID BOGP TANK

Comments:
Ultrasonic A-Scan Inspection:
Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness measurements were performed on shell and nozzles. All readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data next inspection cannot be determined due to thickness readings below t-min on the shell. The material of construction is not known and SA-283-C was used for t-min calculations. The calculated t-min for the shell using these values is .288É?ù which is above the nominal thickness stamped on the data plate.
Update 05/24/2013: PMI Material verification was completed and found the shell and heads consistent with SA-516-70. Minimum thickness and remaining life were recalculated and the next inspection date will be 12/20/2017. The predicted retirement date for this vessel is 06/03/2026 based on a default 2 mil per year corrosion rate. There are 0 caution TMLÉ??s per the current thickness survey completed on 12/20/2012.
API 510 External Inspection:
External inspection found the vessel to be in fair condition. The exterior shell is partially insulated and in fair condition. The paint coating was in good condition with no indications of significant corrosion present. All bolting was secure and there were no significant thread or fastener degradation noted. The foundation was intact, with no indications of setting noted. No ladder or platform is attached to this vessel. There are two (2) PSV attached to this vessel and set @ 70 and 72 PSI which is above the data plate MAWP of 65 PSI.
Recommendations: Reduce PSV set pressures to at or below the data plate stamped MAWP.
API 510 Internal Inspection:
Internal inspection was not completed during this inspection. Internal inspection is recommended at the next planned shut-down.
UltraPipe Unit ID PL-DEHY
UltraPipe Circuit ID V-500

Comments:
Ultrasonic A-Scan Thickness Survey:
Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness measurements were performed on the shell, floor and nozzles. All readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data next inspection date will be 07/25/2018. The predicted retirement date of the tank is 04/11/2045 based on a 2 mil a year default corrosion rate. The next thickness survey will be time based at 5 years to establish a corrosion rate.
API 653 External Inspection:
External inspection found this tank to be a new tank and still under construction and installation is not completed. The external paint coating is in good condition with no areas of product stains or surface rusting. The tank foundation is a crushed rock ring with a steel retaining wall and leak detection points. The retaining wall is completed and is structurally sound. No soil buildup was noted within the rock ring or covering the chime. Miscellaneous tank parts and construction debris lying around the foundation. There is no attached piping or bolted flange connections to this tank at time of inspection.
No roof access or stairway attached to this tank at this time. Installation is not completed on the roof at this time. Up-close inspection of the tank roof was not completed due to limited access. No excessive sagging was noted as visible from the manway.
Recommendations: All miscellaneous parts and debris should be cleared out from the rock ring before going in service. Re-inspect upon completion and prior to placing into service.
API 653 Internal Inspection:
Internal inspection was completed in the as-is condition. The tank is still under construction at this time. All shell and floor bolting is in place and is secure. 1 bolt appears to be missing in the roof plate. All gaskets are in place and appear to be in good condition. No signs of coating chips or scrapes were noted. Several buckets were still inside the tank at the time of inspection. Floor plate thickness is consistent with nominal thickness of .188É?ù
Next internal inspection is due after the tank has been in service for 10 years.
UltraPipe Unit ID PL-WPLNT
UltraPipe Circuit ID T-40

Comments:
Ultrasonic A-Scan Inspection:
Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness measurements were performed on the shell and nozzles. All readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data next inspection date will be 12/17/2017. The predicted retirement date of the tank is 06/02/2040 based on a 2 mil a year default corrosion rate. Retirement date is an average of the earliest 10% of all TML retirement dates for this equipment. There are 0 caution TML locations per the current thickness reading taken 12/17/2012. The next thickness survey will be time based at 5 years to establish a corrosion rate.
API 653 External Inspection:
External inspection found this tank to be in good condition. The external paint coating is in good condition with areas of light product stains and no chipping or peeling noted. The tank foundation is a crushed rock ring with a steel retaining wall. The steel retaining wall is above the grade and is in good condition. There is a leak prevention barrier with leak detection tubes installed in the rock bed. No Soil buildup was noted within the crushed rock foundation. All attached piping to this tank was in good visual condition with no corrosion or pitting noted. All bolted flange connections are free of any leakage. There are 3 ground cables around the perimeter of the tank and all 3 were not attached after tank construction.
The roof access stairway is securely attached to the tank and the paint coating is in fair condition with surface rusting present. The roof coating appears to be intact and in good condition. Up-close inspection of the tank roof was not completed due to limited access. No excessive sagging was noted.
Recommendations: Fasten ground cables to the tank.
The roof access ladder is securely attached to the tank and the paint coating is in poor condition with surface rusting present. Up-close inspection of the tank roof was not completed due to limited access. Several areas of the roof have paint coating failure and corrosion present. Severity of the corrosion could not be assessed due to limited roof access. No excessive sagging was noted.
Recommendations: Completely clean out rock ring and refill with clean rock. Determine the cause of the area flooding and correct to prevent foundation erosion. Areas of coating failure should be cleaned and recoated. Determine cause of shell plate joint leaks and repair. Permanently repair or replace nozzle N-8. Perform internal inspection at next planned shutdown. Provide means for up-close visual and UT thickness inspection of roof.
API 653 Internal Inspection:
Internal inspection was not scheduled at the time of this inspection. The first internal inspection will be due in 10 years.
UltraPipe Unit ID PL-DEHY
UltraPipe Circuit ID T-7

Ultrasonic A-Scan Thickness Survey:
Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness measurements were performed on the shell and roof, nozzles.
All readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data next inspection date will be 0/07/2018. The predicted retirement date of the tank is 05/07/2038 based on a 2 mil a year default corrosion rate. Retirement date is an average of the earliest 10% of all TML retirement dates for this equipment. There are 0 caution TML locations per the current thickness reading taken 01/07/2013. The next thickness survey will be time based at 5 years to establish a corrosion rate.
API 653 External Inspection:
External inspection found this tank to be in fair condition. The external shell is insulated and the insulation is in poor condition. Large gaps in the insulation were found around some nozzles and manways and CUI was present in these locations. There are no visible signs of leakage found around this tank. The tank foundation is a crushed rock ring with steel retaining wall. This retaining wall is in fair condition and securely fastened in the soil. There is excessive soil buildup found in rock bed and covering the chime. All nozzles and man ways were found free of any leakage at time of this inspection.
The roof is accessible by a steel stairway securely attached to the tank. The stairway is in good condition with no corrosion issues noted. The tank roof is 100% insulated with fiber glass and the insulation is in poor condition with several holes in the insulation noted. None of the holes were accessible at this time for inspection of the roof deck below the insulation. No signs of roof deck sagging were noted at this time.
Recommendations: Remove excess soil built up in rock bed and around retaining ring and restore rock ring with clean rock to restore foundation drainage. Remove insulation around the tank chime so the bottom to shell joint can be inspected. Remove 2É?? x 2É?? sections of insulation at random locations around the shell to inspect for CUI. Consider completely removing insulation and re-inspecting. Consider performing internal inspection. The next external visual inspection will be time based at 5 years.
API 653 Internal Inspection:
Internal inspection was not scheduled at the time of this inspection. Internal inspection is recommended at the next planned shutdown.

Comments:
Ultrasonic A-Scan Thickness Inspection:
Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness measurements were completed in accordance with Applus RTD ‚Äì Valley Industrial
X-Ray established procedures. 13 thickness measurement locations (TMLs) were established and thickness measurements were taken at these locations. All thickness readings are baseline therefore an actual retirement date or corrosion rate cannot be calculated until a second UT inspection has been performed at the exact locations.
All thickness readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data next inspection will be 12/13/2022 & the predicted retirement date of the circuit is 08/21/2154 based on a 2 mill default corrosion rate.
There are 0 caution TMLs per the current thickness reading taken on 12/13/12.
API 570 Visual Inspection:
Visual inspection found this piping circuit to be in good condition. During the inspection the line was found completely insulated and supported. Light indentations were found on the insulation. Support shoes and shoe brackets are in good condition with minor surface rust. The piping was inspected for code compliance issues and to identify possible leaks, stresses and any condition that might reduce the life of the piping circuit. All piping will be put on a maximum 10 year thickness inspection interval per API (class 3 piping) requirements. Some piping TML locations may require re-inspection prior to the maximum interval. See UltraPIPE data reports for all required inspection dates.
All piping will require an API 570 Visual inspection in 10 years.
UltraPipe Unit ID SW
UltraPipe Circuit ID WELL_64-64B_FL

Inspection Dates:

Next: 07/05/2017
Inspector: Ronnie Harleston
Report(s):
INSPECTION REPORT
689 KB
ULTRAPIPE DATA REPORT
118.08 KB
FIELD DRAWING
2.55 MB
Comments:
Ultrasonic A-Scan Thickness Survey:
Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness measurements were performed on the shell, nozzles, roof and floor. All readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data next inspection date will be 07/05/2017. The predicted retirement date of the tank is 04/25/2031 based on a 2 mil a year default corrosion rate. Retirement date is an average of the earliest 10% of all TML retirement dates for this equipment. There are 0 caution TML locations per the current thickness reading taken 01/03/2013.
API 653 External Inspection:
External inspection found this tank to be still under construction and installation is not completed. The external paint coating is in good condition with no areas of product stains or surface rusting. The tank foundation is a crushed rock ring with a steel retaining wall, leak prevention barrier and leak detection. The retaining wall is completed and is structurally sound. No soil buildup was noted within the rock ring or covering the chime in places. Miscellaneous tank parts and construction debris lying around the foundation. There is no attached piping or bolted flange connections to this tank at time of inspection.
The roof access stairway is securely attached to the tank and it is constructed out of galvanized steel. Installation is not completed on the roof at this time. Up-close inspection of the tank roof was not completed due to limited access. No excessive sagging was noted.
Recommendations: All miscellaneous parts and debris should be cleared out from the rock ring before going in service. Re-inspect upon completion of construction prior to going into service.
API 653 Internal Inspection:
Internal inspection was completed at this stage of construction. 1 roof panel was missing as well as a few nozzles. No internal piping was installed, if any, at this time. Internal surfaces are in new condition and appear to be properly assembled. All internal paint coatings were in good condition with no chips or scrapes noted. Re-inspection is recommended once final construction has been completed.
UltraPipe Unit ID POSO
UltraPipe Circuit ID New SW Tank

Comments:
Ultrasonic A-Scan Thickness Inspection:
Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness measurements were completed in accordance with Applus RTD established procedures. 27 Thickness measurement locations (TMLs) were established and thickness measurements were taken at these locations. All thickness readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data next inspection will be 02/25/2021. The predicted retirement date of the circuit is 01/24/2043 based on calculated corrosion rates and a 2 mil per year default corrosion rate. There is 0 caution TMLs per the current thickness survey taken on 02/26/2016.
API 570 Visual Inspection:
This transfer line was installed in 2013 and inspected. A section of this piping will fall into the new pipeline management plan and be reclassified as class 1 piping. To meet the new classification some new TML‚Äôs were added to achieve this goal. See new drawing and photo for locations. This piping circuit was in service at the time of inspection. A visual inspection was performed and found the piping circuit to be in good condition. One injection point was located on the piping circuit .The flange bolting was intact, with no significant thread or fastener degradation found. The piping supports are covered with light to moderate surface rust and no significant problems were present. The piping was inspected for code compliance issues and to identify possible leaks, stresses and any condition that might reduce the life of the piping circuit. All piping will be put on a maximum 5 year thickness inspection interval per API (class 1 piping) requirements. Some piping TML locations may require re-inspection prior to the maximum interval. See Ultra PIPE data reports for all required inspection dates.
All piping will require an API 570 Visual inspection in 5 years.
UltraPipe Unit ID HOMEBASE
UltraPipe Circuit ID 8"" FW TO SAC-1

{vsig}/homebase/t2000{/vsig}
Field: Homebase
Location: SMWSS
Equipment ID: T-2000
Inspection Dates:
Last: 01/02/2013
Next: 01/02/2018
Inspector: James Reese
Report(s):
INSPECTION REPORT
1.07 MB
ULTRAPIPE DATA REPORT
43.73 KB
FIELD DRAWING
2.35 MB
Comments:
Ultrasonic A-Scan Thickness Survey:
Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness measurements were performed on the shell and nozzles. All readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data next inspection date will be 01/02/2018. The predicted retirement date of the tank is 11/18/2023 based on a 2 mil a year default corrosion rate. Retirement date is an average of the earliest 10% of all TML retirement dates for this equipment. There are 0 caution TML locations per the current thickness reading taken 01/02/2013. The next thickness survey will be time based at 5 years to establish a corrosion rate.
API 653 External Inspection:
External inspection found this tank to be in fair condition. The external paint coating is in fair condition with areas of product stains and light corrosion/surface rusting. The tank foundation is a crushed rock ring with a steel retaining wall. The retaining wall is below grade level in some areas and could not be completely inspected. Exposed portions of the steel retaining wall were found to be in good condition. Soil buildup was noted within the rock ring and covering the chime in places. Soil buildup was cleared in areas around the chime and surface rusting was noted. Visible signs of potential past leaks were noted found on some shell plate seams possibly caused by loose bolting or failed gaskets. Seam gaskets show signs of deterioration and cracking. The cleanout cover shows visible signs of past leaks. No active leaks at this time. The level indicator on the target board the cable is broken.
The roof access ladder is securely attached to the tank and the paint coating is in fair condition with surface rusting present. Up-close inspection of the tank roof was not completed due to limited access. Several areas of the roof have paint coating failure and corrosion present. Heavy deposits were found around a roof nozzle. Deposits and coating bubbles were found around the thief hatch. Severity of the corrosion could not be assessed due to limited roof access. No excessive sagging was noted.
Recommendations: Remove soil build-up from rock ring and from tank chime. Re-grade the area around the foundation to divert rain water around the foundation. Areas of coating failure should be cleaned and recoated. Replace damaged plate gaskets and check bolting torque as necessary. Replace broken cable on level indicator. Perform up-close inspection of roof external to determine condition of corroded areas. Perform internal inspection at earliest convenience.
API 653 Internal Inspection:
Internal inspection was not scheduled at the time of this inspection. Internal inspection is recommended at the next planned shutdown.
UltraPipe Unit ID HOMEBASE
UltraPipe Circuit ID T-2000

Comments:
Ultrasonic A-Scan Thickness Inspection:
Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness measurements were completed in accordance with Applus RTD ‚Äì Valley Industrial
X-Ray established procedures. 11 thickness measurement locations (TMLs) were established and thickness measurements were taken at these locations. The circuit consists of 2‚Äù & 3‚Äù schedule 80, 1500# flanges. The readings taken are considered baseline readings. An actual retirement date cannot be accurately calculated until a second UT inspection has been completed at the exact locations. All thickness readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data next inspection will be 11/24/2022 based on a default 2 mill corrosion rate. The predicted retirement date of the circuit is 05/26/2055 based on a default 2 mill corrosion rate.
There are 0 caution TMLs per the current thickness reading taken on 11/24/2012.
API 570 Visual Inspection:
Visual inspection found this piping circuit to be in good condition. The support shoes and shoe brackets are in good condition with minor surface rust. The insulation has minor indentations and no seals were found. Minor surface rust was found on the flanges and bolting. The piping was inspected for code compliance issues and to identify possible leaks, stresses and any condition that might reduce the life of the piping circuit. All piping will be put on a maximum 10 year thickness inspection interval per API (class 3 piping) requirements. Some piping TML locations may require re-inspection prior to the maximum interval. See UltraPIPE data reports for all required inspection dates.
All piping will require an API 570 Visual inspection in 10 years.
UltraPipe Unit ID TIDEWTR
UltraPipe Circuit ID WELL_42-30B_FL

Ultrasonic A-Scan Thickness Inspection:
Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness measurements were completed in accordance with Applus RTD ‚Äì Valley Industrial
X-Ray established procedures. 15 thickness measurement locations (TMLs) were established and thickness measurements were taken at these locations. TML 13 (45¬∞ fitting) was recorded as 0.266‚Äù which is 0.003‚Äù mills higher than 12.5% tolerance for new piping and fittings allowed for suppliers. This is a new fitting and corrosion was not a factor for the thin reading recorded. All readings are considered baseline therefore an actual corrosion rate and retirement date cannot be accurately calculated until a second UT inspection has been performed at the exact locations.
All thickness readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data, next inspection will be 01/07/2023 and the predicted retirement date of the circuit is 07/08/2056 based on a default 2 mil per year corrosion rate.
There are 0 caution TMLs per the current thickness reading taken on 12/28/2012.
API 570 Visual Inspection:
Visual inspection found this piping circuit to be in good condition. Surface rust was found around welds, heat affected zones, support shoes, bolting, and insulation interfaces. No seals were found but the insulation sheeting is in good condition. All supports are secure. The piping was inspected for code compliance issues and to identify possible leaks, stresses and any condition that might reduce the life of the piping circuit. All piping will be put on a maximum 10 year thickness inspection interval per API (class 3 piping) requirements. Some piping TML locations may require re-inspection prior to the maximum interval. See UltraPIPE data reports for all required inspection dates.

Comments:
Ultrasonic A-Scan Thickness Inspection:
Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness measurements were completed in accordance with Applus RTD ‚Äì Valley Industrial
X-Ray established procedures. 17 thickness measurement locations (TMLs) were established and thickness measurements were taken at these locations. All readings are considered baseline therefore an actual corrosion rate and retirement date cannot be accurately calculated until a second UT inspection has been performed at the exact locations.
All thickness readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data, next inspection will be 01/08/2023 and the predicted retirement date of the circuit is 01/08/2058 based on default 2 mils per year corrosion rate.
There are 0 caution TMLs per the current thickness reading taken on 01/08/2012.
API 570 Visual Inspection:
Visual inspection found this piping circuit to be in good condition. Surface rust was found around welds, heat affected zones, support shoes, bolting, and insulation interfaces. No seals were found but the insulation sheeting is in good condition. All supports are secure. The piping was inspected for code compliance issues and to identify possible leaks, stresses and any condition that might reduce the life of the piping circuit. All piping will be put on a maximum 10 year thickness inspection interval per API (class 3 piping) requirements. Some piping TML locations may require re-inspection prior to the maximum interval. See UltraPIPE data reports for all required inspection dates.
All piping will require an API 570 Visual inspection in 10 years.
UltraPipe Unit ID BELGIAN
UltraPipe Circuit ID WELL_23-17B_FL

The next thickness survey will be time based at 5 years.
API 510 External Inspection:
External inspection found the vessel to be in good condition. The coating on the vessels exterior shell and heads are in good condition. This vessel is supported by four legs and structurally sounds. All anchors bolts were securely fastened to the concrete foundation. The concrete foundation is above grade level and in good condition with no chipping or cracking noted. There is one PSV located on this vessel and it is on the top head. The PSV pressure is set at 225 PSIG. All bolted flange and threaded connections to the shell and heads. There is no visual evidence of leakage or corrosion found. The next internal inspection will be time based at 5 years.
API 510 Internal Inspection:
Internal inspection was not completed during this inspection. The next internal inspection will be time based at 10 years.

Comments:
Ultrasonic A-Scan Thickness Inspection
Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness measurements were completed in accordance with Applus RTD É?? Valley Industrial
X-Ray established procedures. 140 thickness measurement locations (TMLs) were established and thickness measurements were taken at these locations.
All thickness readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data next inspection will be 12/06/2017 based on a default corrosion rate of 2 mills per year. The predicted retirement date of the circuit is 11/01/2036.
There are 3 caution TMLs per the current thickness reading taken on 12/06/2012.
API 570 Visual Inspection
Visual inspection found the first section of this piping circuit to be in poor condition. This section starts at TML 1 and goes to TML 130 of this piping circuit. The first section of this piping is not coated. The piping is cover with moderate surface rust. At the area of TML 112 some external corrosion and pitting was found. The piping was cover with a light brown rust color stain on 90% of the piping and 10% of this piping circuit was insulated and found in poor condition missing sheeting are loose at road crossing and a section running over a small valley. In some areas there is soil that has washed down from the hill side and is covering the piping with dirt É??soilÉ?ù. In some areas the dirt soil was extracted around the piping and founding a rust scale built up around the piping no visual evident of external corrosion are pitting found. Noted there was a small invitation found next to TML 88 possibly struck by a back hole at one time no visual evident of any significant damage. All piping supports were found to be in place and in fair condition. All bolted flange connections are free of any leakage or corrosion. The piping was inspected for code compliance issues and to identify possible leaks, stresses and any condition that might reduce the life of the piping circuit. All piping will be put on a maximum 5 year thickness inspection interval per API (class 2 piping) requirements. Some piping TML locations may require re-inspection prior to the maximum interval. See UltraPIPE data reports for all required inspection dates.
Recommendation: Repair or replace insulation in the needed areas that requires attention. Remove the soil around the piping and re inspected the areas for corrosion or external pitting.

Comments:
1. SCOPE:
Ultrasonic Thickness inspection was performed on the new floor plates in tank T-967. This inspection consisted of 3 readings per floor plate.
2. PURPOSE:
Inspections were performed to ensure compliance with the Division of Oil, Gas, and Geothermal Resources (DOGGR) and to obtain baseline thickness readings for future inspections.
3. BASE ASSUMPTIONS:
3.1. The concrete foundation is adequate to provide leak detection and leak prevention.
3.2. Minimum thickness for the bottom is 0.050É?ù per California regulations.
3.3. Date of construction: December 2015 (floor only)
3.4. Nominal thickness: 0.125É?ù
3.5. A default corrosion rate of 0.002É?ù/yr was applied for remaining life calculations and retirement dates.
3.6. The next inspection interval is set at the lesser of 20 years or half the estimated remaining life.
4. ULTRAPIPE SUMMARY:
There are 0 caution TMLÉ??s at this time. The next inspection date for is 12/27/2032. The predicted retirement date is 12/27/2049. The lowest thickness found was .118É?ù on plate 4 and 8. Estimated remaining life is 34 years. Reference UltraPIPE data report for complete inspection results.
5. INSPECTION COMMENTS/ CONCERNS / RECOMMENDATIONS:
At this time no areas of concern in regards to thickness were noted.
UltraPipe Unit ID FAIRFLD
UltraPipe Circuit ID
T-967 / T-967 FLOOR

Comments:

Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness measurements were completed in accordance with Applus RTD ‚Äì Valley Industrial
X-Ray established procedures. 15 thickness measurement locations (TMLs) were established and thickness measurements were taken at these locations. One reading was found below the allowed 12.5% tolerance given to new piping. This reading was found on TML 2 and the reading recorded was 0.189‚Äù. 0.191‚Äù is the limit for the 12.5% of 0.218‚Äù nominal wall for schedule 80 2‚Äù piping and fittings. This is only to note that corrosion/erosion was not involved with the thickness reading recorded for this fitting. Suggest contacting the supplier regarding the materials received for construction are below code standards. Thicknesses recorded for the entire circuit are acceptable for service. All readings are considered baseline therefore an actual corrosion rate and retirement date cannot be accurately calculated until a second UT inspection has been performed at the exact locations.
All thickness readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data, next inspection will be 01/15/2023 and the predicted retirement date of the circuit is 01/15/2053 based on a default of 2 mils per year corrosion rate.
There are 0 caution TMLs per the current thickness reading taken on 01/15/2013.

Comments:
Ultrasonic A-Scan Thickness Inspection:
Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness measurements were completed in accordance with Applus established procedures. 25 Thickness measurement locations (TMLs) were established and thickness measurements were taken at these locations.
All thickness readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data next inspection will be 2/27/2019 based on a default corrosion rate of 2 MPY. The predicted retirement date of the circuit is 10/28/2046.
There are 0 caution TMLs per the current thickness reading taken on 2/27/2014.
API 570 Visual Inspection:
Visual inspection found this piping circuit to be in fair condition. This piping circuit is not coated or been coated. The surface condition is covered with light brown surface rust. No visual sign of corrosion or pitting was found. All bolted flange and threaded connection are free of any leakage. The pipe supports are structurally sound and no significant problem. In some areas the piping is running above and below grade. The piping below grade recommend remove excess soil and re inspected the piping and then coat or warp the piping to protect it from future corrosion. This piping circuit ties in to Formax West main emulsion line. The piping was inspected for code compliance issues and to identify possible leaks, stresses and any condition that might reduce the life of the piping circuit. All piping will be put on a one year thickness inspection interval per customer. Some piping TML locations may require re-inspection prior to the maximum interval. See UltraPIPE data reports for all required inspection dates.
All piping will require an API 570 Visual inspection in 5 years.

All thickness readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data next inspection will be 1/29/2018 based on a default corrosion rate of 2 mills per year. The predicted retirement date of the circuit is 1/17/2043.
There are 0 caution TMLs per the current thickness reading taken on 1/29/2013.
API 570 Visual Inspection:
Visual inspection found this piping circuit to be in good visual condition. This piping circuit is not coated or insulated. There is light surface rust on 100% of this piping circuit. There is no indication of corrosion or leakage noted. All bolted flange and threaded connection are free of any leakage or corrosion. All piping support was in place and visible look to be in sound condition with no significant problem noted. The piping was inspected for code compliance issues and to identify possible leaks, stresses and any condition that might reduce the life of the piping circuit. All piping will be put on a maximum 5 year thickness inspection interval per API (class 2 piping) requirements. Some piping TML locations may require re-inspection prior to the maximum interval. See UltraPIPE data reports for all required inspection dates.
All piping will require an API 570 Visual inspection in 5 years. All injection locations have been inspected per API 570 and put on a 3 year inspection interval.
UltraPipe Unit ID ETHEL-D
UltraPipe Circuit ID DIAT HDR1 GRP LN

Comments:
Ultrasonic A-Scan Thickness Inspection
Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness measurements were completed in accordance with Applus RTD established procedures. 318 thickness measurement locations (TMLs) were established and thickness measurements were taken at these locations. All thickness readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data next inspection will be 12/17/2024. The predicted retirement date of the circuit is 12/18/2034 based on calculated corrosion rates and a 2 mil per year default corrosion rate. There are 0 caution TMLs per the current thickness survey taken on 12/18/2014.
API 570 Visual Inspection
This group line begins in the area around T-101 and ends at Tank 1002 in central facilities. This piping circuit was in service at the time of inspection. Visual inspection found this piping circuit to be in good condition. This piping circuit is 70 % insulated and found to be in fair condition with no significant problems. The exposed piping surface is covered with light to moderate surface rust and no visual sign of any external corrosion or pitting present. All bolted flange and threaded connection were free of any leakage. The bolting and gaskets were intact with no significant thread or fastener degradation. The piping supports were found to be intact and structurally sound with no significant problems. In some areas shoes were attached to this piping circuit and no significant problems was found. They are multiple headers tie ‚Äì in to this piping circuit to transfer product. The piping was inspected for code compliance issues and to identify possible leaks, stresses and any condition that might reduce the life of the piping circuit. All piping will be put on a maximum 10 year thickness inspection interval per API (class 3 piping) requirements. Some piping TML locations may require re-inspection prior to the maximum interval. See UltraPIPE data reports for all required inspection dates.
All piping will require an API 570 Visual inspection in 10 years.

Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness measurements were completed in accordance with Applus RTD É?? Valley Industrial
X-Ray established procedures. All thickness readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data next inspection will be 11/17/2017 and the predicted retirement date will be 05/21/2032 based on default 2 mils per year.

Visual inspection found these piping circuits to be in good condition. A small oil leak was found on a threaded 2É?ù TEE. The leak is minimal but it is apparent. Lines are fully supported with surface rust on the supports and shoes. Surface rust was found on the pipe & welds. The PSVÉ??s are in good condition with the service tags securely attached. All bolting was secure, gaskets are in place and valves are in good operating condition. The piping was inspected for code compliance issues and to identify possible leaks, stresses and any condition that might reduce the life of the piping circuit. All piping will be put on a maximum 5 year thickness inspection interval per API (class 2 piping) requirements. Some piping TML locations may require re-inspection prior to the maximum interval. See UltraPIPE data reports for all required inspection dates.
All piping will require an API 570 Visual inspection in 5 years.
